issues.summary: Capture Android app  / Line Listing relative period/numeric filters
issues.creator: George McGuire
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### **Use case (context)**

Any Line Listing report in the Capture Android app with either:

A) columns with dates/times

B) columns with numeric values

**Use case A): Date/time filter**

**As any DHIS2 user** using any Line Listing report (offline) in the Capture Android app

**When** - Filtering a column with dates (or dates/times)

**I want to** - Select a relative time period such as "Today", "Last 3 days", "Last 7 days" as well as combine "Today" + "Last 3 days", "Today" + "Last 7 days" etc.

**So I can** - easily limit the selected data to the time period of interest (for example selecting a start and end date would be too fiddly on a mobile device).

**Who faces this problem**

Any DHIS2 user wanting to analyse a date or date/time column for a certain time period.

**How do they solve these problems today?**

** Filtering for a certain date value such as 2025-08-23 (only works for filter a certain day and it is time consuming to type a specific date, particularly on a mobile device, not clear whether this would work with a date/time stamp)

** Scrolling up and down the table to find the period of interest (without applying any filter)

**Use case B): filters for numeric fields**

**As any DHIS2 user** using any Line Listing report (offline) in the Capture Android app

**When** - Filtering a column with numeric values

**I want to** - select a value range such as "<0" (less than zero), "=0" (equal to zero), ">x" (greater than x) or a range between two numeric values

**So I can** - limit the selected data to the numeric values of interest. For example filtering for all healthcare products with stock on hand = 0 or all stock corrections with positive values.

**Who faces this problem**

Any DHIS2 user wanting to filter a column with numeric values for a certain value range

**How do they solve these problems today?**

** Filtering for a certain value (however, filtering for "3" will return 3, 13, 300, 53 etc. which is not useful)

** Scrolling up and down the table to find the numeric value of interest (without applying any filter)

issues.summary: Capture app: Improved UI for adding and editing events in locked periods
issues.creator: Karoline Tufte Lien
issues.description:
When a program has the expiryPeriodType (and expiry days) set, no new events should be added in the locked period(after the period defined in expiryperiod plus program.expirydays has passed). The exception is when someone has the authority to edit expired data. See linked issue.

The API does not let you create these events, but the user would not know until they try to add/save the event and get the errorr {{Error saving the enrollment event}} message. Now there is frontend validation in Capture app, There is also additional validation that if the event has a date in the locked period, the ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù button should even be disabled, so one step before not allowing the form to be saved.

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

issues.summary: Capture Android app / Line Listing report: freeze first row
issues.creator: George McGuire
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

*State the problem you‚Äôre trying to solve.  You can frame this as a job-to-be-done:*

As any DHIS2 user using a Line Listing report in the Capture Android app (especially if the Line Listing report has many columns):

When - *I scroll up and down a Line Listing report (beyond the first page)*

I want to - *see the ‚Äúheader row‚Äù on the top of every page*

So I can - *easily identify the header (name) and therefore the content of the column (especially if there are many numeric columns, if the columns contain text, yes/no options it may be more obvious what they refer to)*

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

*Identified during the DHIS2-RTS (Real-Time Stock management) Tracker implementation in the Comoros where it was requested by a storekeeper. But certainly useful for any DHIS2 user consulting a Line Listing report in the Capture Android app.*

### How do they solve these problems today?

** The user knows what data is displayed in what column
** The user scrolls all the way to the top if s/he is not sure what the respective column contains
- Limiting the number of (numeric) columns to one or two so that users can easily memorise the header name and contents of each of the columns

### Comment

This feature has always been available from the very beginning of the Line Listing web app.
As an example of the complexity of a Line Listing table which is actually in use in the Comoros project and which is a DHIS2-RTS standard:

!image-20250801-204807.png|width=1562,height=287,alt="image-20250801-204807.png"!

issues.summary: Program rules: Allow import/export of program rules in CSV
issues.creator: Karoline Tufte Lien
issues.description:
**Objective**: enhancing mass-editing by allowing [1] CSV prg rule import/ export

**2. Allow CSV import/ export of program rules**
Complex data capture forms, validations, plus interactive recommendations in the form of on-screen messages, feedback(**1) or management events(**2) require hundreds of rules for a single program. In most cases they need to be created and maintained outside the system. XML and JSON are currently supported - but if we were to allow CSV, mass editing using a simple spreadsheet will empower non-it staff to edit complex rules, particularly if proposal [3] (direct referent to data values without requiring prg rule variables) is implemented

(**1) Tracker widget 'feedback'
(**2) Upcoming Tracker widget 'management'

issues.summary: A configurable in-app tutorial for DHIS2 Web and Capture apps to guide users through key features, reduce reliance on external training, support offline use, and improve onboarding in low-resource or high-turnover settings.
issues.creator: Raphael Kenyuri
issues.description:
**Problem Definition**

**What problem or job are we addressing?**

In order to deploy DHIS2 applications efficiently and at scale, implementers including ICRC and many other partners face a persistent challenge: reducing reliance on traditional training sessions (virtual or in-person) to onboard users. This issue is not unique to ICRC or a specific use case; it is a universal barrier to efficient DHIS2 adoption across different countries, sectors, and implementations.

While documentation and training materials exist, when these are hosted externally, users are less likely to access or engage with them especially when under time pressure, dealing with poor connectivity, or operating in resource-limited settings.

**User Story and Scenario**

**As a** DHIS2 user (e.g., a health worker using the RTS app for the first time),
**When** I log into the app and feel unsure where to begin,
**I want to** access a built-in tutorial that highlights core features, shows me what to do step-by-step, and adapts to my user role,
**So I can** quickly become self-sufficient, confident, and productive without waiting for external training or guides.

This is especially relevant when:

** Users return to the system after a long absence (e.g., due to staff turnover).
** Solutions are updated or reconfigured, requiring quick re-orientation.
** Implementers deploy the solution in new settings where training resources are limited.

**Proposed Feature**

Introduce a configurable, embedded in-app tutorial system for DHIS2 Web and Capture apps that:

** Appears on **first login** and is accessible anytime from a ‚ÄúHelp‚Äù or ‚ÄúLearn‚Äù menu.
** Supports interactive, step-by-step walkthroughs that highlight key UI elements and actions (e.g., ‚Äúclick here to submit a report‚Äù).
** Is role-aware, showing relevant steps based on user access levels.
** Can be configured offline, allowing tutorials to be bundled with the application package for use in low-connectivity environments.
** Offers anonymous usage tracking (optional), helping developers and implementers understand which tutorial steps are most helpful or confusing.
** Enables customization by implementers, allowing them to include localized content, links to relevant resources, or context-specific instructions.

**Who Faces This Problem & Why It Matters**

This challenge affects a broad spectrum of DHIS2 users globally from frontline health workers to data officers in humanitarian settings. It is especially pressing in:

** Low-resource or fragile environments, where internet connectivity is unreliable and scheduled trainings are difficult.
** Programs with high staff turnover, where onboarding must be repeatable and asynchronous.
** Large-scale deployments, where central training is logistically complex and costly.

For many, the lack of in-app onboarding leads to:

** Underutilization of key features,
** Increased helpdesk load,
** Delays in data reporting and decision-making,
** Reduced satisfaction with the application.

**Current Workarounds (and their Limitations)**

**Current onboarding approaches include**:

** Live virtual or in-person training sessions, which require coordination, bandwidth, and time.
** Sharing PDFs, videos, or links to external learning platforms, which often go unused or are forgotten.
** Embedding notes or ‚Äúhelp‚Äù text within the app, which lacks interactivity and user engagement.

These methods are often ineffective, especially when the user is new, overwhelmed, or in a hurry.

**Expected Impact**

An embedded, interactive tutorial will:

** Reduce onboarding time and support costs,
** Improve user satisfaction and app adoption,
** Support self-paced learning and re-orientation,
- Foster broader usability in humanitarian and health contexts.

issues.summary: Ability to control uploaded image quality
issues.creator: Nancy Espinoza
issues.description:
## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

Images uploaded through tracked entity attributes or program stages (DEs) are automatically compressed to a medium quality to optimize for performance. However, this trade-off results in images that are sometimes visually degraded, making it difficult for users to clearly view important details in photos

There is no way for implementers or users to adjust image quality settings based on their context or needs

### Proposed Solution:

Introduce an option to configure or choose image quality levels (e.g., low / medium / high) 

### Reference

This idea is based on [this DHIS2 Community post](https://community.dhis2.org/t/how-to-control-quality-of-uploaded-image/41407/6), where a user expresses the need for higher image quality, rather than simply reducing size. Currently, DHIS2 enforces medium-quality compression, with no option to change it.

issues.summary: Relative period for 2 months ago
issues.creator: Shurajit Dutta - DHIS2
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

The use case here is that most MoH have a reporting period deadline of something like 10-15 days into the next month, so when I use the last month as a relative period on a visualization, the first 10-15 days the dashboard might just be empty; then when it does get populated I might have a very short time to review it. 

## Feature Description

As an example, if its July 1 this relative period type would take its data from May only. 

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

A specific use case here is routine DQ investigation, where it may take a little more time then whats available by using last month as the relative period for its visualizations to investigate and correct issues, in addition to seeing a number of empty visualizations on the dashboard for half of the month.¬† However, any implementation with a reporting period deadline in the middle of the next month will have the same challenge.

## ‚ùì Problem Description

Users see empty dashboards for half of the month, then only have half a month to respond to the data they are seeing before they visualizations update again and they are empty once more.

## ü§î¬†Assumptions

N/A

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

Working with the Ghana implementation on Data Quality.

## (!)¬†Out of Scope

N/A

issues.summary: Tracker ACL Improvements
issues.creator: Marta Vila
issues.description:
We need to improve ACL validation to fix functional issues and enhance performance across tracked entities, enrollments, and events.

Some of the problems to address are:

** Pagination is broken when ACL checks are run after fetching data from the DB.
** Missing error feedback in {{TrackerOwnershipController}} gives the false impression that ownership was transferred.
** Inefficient ACL checks in {{/trackedEntities}}: we can skip some validations based on request params (e.g., program, tracked entity type).
** Enrollment store uses Hibernate, causing N+1 queries when fetching notes and attributes. Switching to JDBC would avoid this.

issues.summary: Separation of Tracker Program Events and Event Program Events
issues.creator: Marta Vila
issues.description:
There are 2 quite different types of events in the system, single events and tracker events. Single events are not tracker-based because they are not attached to a tracked entity but register a generic one-time event in a program.Tracker events, however, are linked to a tracked entity and a specific enrollment. Both types of events are modeled by the same objects and tables but some fields are specific only to one of them. For example, single events use an enrollment placeholder, with a null tracked entity, only to work the same as tracker events.

Modeling two different entities in the same way creates a few problems all over the system:

** Different validations are applied to different types, so in the validation code is common to find the check to differentiate between types.
** Missing fields that do not make sense for one or another type need to be added by preprocessors in the tracker importer. 
** ACL works differently in each type.
** The placeholder enrollment can have ~thousands/millions of events while a tracker enrollment generally has few events. Mixing the two types in some parts of the code can lead to serious performance issues.
** Rule engine works differently for program events and tracker events.
** Event exporter need to deal with 2 different types of event and cannot be easily optimized.

We will there separate tracker events and single events in importer/exporter to improve all the points above as well as performance.

## Release notes description

Support for Apache doris as dedicated analytics database architecture for aggregate and individual data. Deploying a dedicated analytics database architecture is to improve performance in query executions and the Analytics table update time. It also represents a modernization of analytics backend code incorporating Object orientation and abstraction and improved test automation coverage.

Dedicated analytics database will be available for implementations to set up and test for aggregated data in v42 and individual data in v43.

*We have lately been struggling to run analytics on large databases; yet sometimes, the need arises from a minor change in data that does not require running analytics for the entire database. issues.summary: Dynamic period selection for sync parameters
issues.creator: Joan NAKIBUUKA
issues.description:
1. In **Settings ‚Üí Synchronization ‚Üí Programs ‚Üí Download TEIs updated within**, there is no option to define dynamic or custom date ranges. Users expect to select flexible options such as "This month" or define specific start and end dates to control the volume and relevance of data synced.
1. The **scheduling mechanism** for metadata and data sync currently uses relative durations (e.g., sync every 6h), but there is no way to define exact sync times. Implementers request a time-based scheduler ‚Äî for example, metadata sync every day at 8:00 AM or data sync every hour, excluding working hours ‚Äî to better align sync with user activity and network availability.

issues.summary: Command palette
issues.creator: Kai Vandivier
issues.description:
## Release notes description

The Command Palette is a new navigation feature that replaces the apps menu in the header bar. It provides navigation to apps as before, and introduces **actions** and **shortcuts**. Shortcuts are ‚Äúdeep links‚Äù to sections of an app, for example a particular page in the Maintenance app. Apps can define their shortcuts in their configuration files, then they will be visible and searchable in the Command Palette. Actions are scripts or jobs that can be run anywhere, and could be tasks like clearing caches or running analytics.

It is keyboard navigable, and can be opened It can be opened by either the {{Ctrl}} {{K}} or {{Cmd}} {{K}} keyboard shortcut, depending on the user‚Äôs operating system. It can also be opened by clicking on the apps icon in the header bar.

Documentation | Feature card | Screenshot 1 | 2 | 3

issues.summary: Route manager app
issues.creator: Kai Vandivier
issues.customfield_10194: The Route Manager app is now available on the App Hub. It provides a user interface for managing Routes, which are secure ways of connecting DHIS2 to external services.
issues.description:
## Release notes description

The Route Manager app is now available on the App Hub. It provides a user interface for managing Routes, which are secure ways of connecting DHIS2 to external services. The app enables creating, editing, and deleting Route objects, and allows the user to configure the authentication parameters a Route uses, the authorities required to run that Route, and sharing settings for the Route object.

[Documentation](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/use/user-guides/dhis-core-version-242/maintaining-the-system/route-manager.html) | [Feature card](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/releases/screenshots/42/42-extend-route-manager.png)

issues.summary: New Routes API features
issues.creator: Kai Vandivier
issues.customfield_10194: Routes can now be set up with more authentication schemes: authentication by custom headers, query parameters, or OAuth2 Client Credentials is now supported, in addition to the HTTP Basic auth and API token methods available previously.
issues.description:
## Release notes description

Routes can now be set up with more authentication schemes: authentication by custom headers, query parameters, or OAuth2 Client Credentials is now supported, in addition to the HTTP Basic auth and API token methods available previously.

Routes can also now be configured with custom timeout limits: this decides the time that the DHIS2 server will wait for a response from an upstream service before returning a timeout error.

[Documentation](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/develop/using-the-api/dhis-core-version-master/route.html#running-a-route-with-authentication) | Feature card

issues.description:
## Release notes description

issues.summary: Global app shell
issues.creator: Kai Vandivier
issues.description:
## Release notes description

DHIS2 now features a Global App Shell, which serves as a container for any of the apps that are loaded. It ensures a consistent header bar and navigation interface across all apps and consolidates functionality that is required by all apps. It can be used to roll out new features to all apps at once, like the new Command Palette, and will be useful for deploying further technical upgrades to the app platform.

The introduction of the Global Shell brings with it also some design upgrades in the header bar: it is more compact to give more space to app content and includes a modern design for the user profile menu.

[Documentation](https://developers.dhis2.org/docs/references/global-shell) | [Feature card](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/releases/screenshots/42/42-extend-global-shell.png)

issues.summary: Maps: Functional and UX Improvements
issues.creator: Karoline Tufte Lien

issues.description:
## Release notes description

** **Allow selecting the user org unit in combination with other org units and/or org unit levels:** You can now combine org unit selections by selecting user org unit as well as other org units and org unit levels in all layer types.
** **Support custom calculations**: You can now utilize custom calculations created in Data Visualization app in Maps app.
**  **Additional information in pop-up for Tracked Entity Layers:** Pop-up now displays Coordinates, Org Unit name and attributes if marked to be displayed in list (similarly to Event layer pop-ups).
** **Enhanced support for type of relationships in Tracked Entity layer:** Experimental relationships mapping now supports a broader variety of relationships definitions: unidirectional and bidirectional relationships and permutations of: same TrackedEntity type and same program (or program not specified), same TrackedEntity type but different program (or one program not specified) or different TrackedEntity types.

[Feature card](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/releases/screenshots/42/42-analyze-maps-functional-improvements.png)

issues.summary: Export idScheme
issues.creator: Marta Vila
issues.customfield_10194: The IdSchemes of the old tracker exported and the new one (NTI) have been aligned. Until now, NTI supported import with idSchemes, but not export, export is supported now.
issues.description:
## Release notes description

The IdScheme support in the old tracker endpoints and the new Tracker endpoints have been aligned. Until now, New Tracker endpoints only supported importing tracker data with different idSchemes, but not when exporting. Exporting with different idSchemes is supported now.

The query parameters implemented are idScheme, categoryOptionComboIdScheme, categoryOptionIdScheme, dataElementIdScheme, orgUnitIdScheme, programIdScheme, programStageIdScheme. And valid values are one of UID, CODE, NAME, ATTRIBUTE:{uid}. 

The default is UID. All (supported) metadata is exported using the {{idScheme}} value unless it is overridden by one of the metadata-specific parameters. There might be metadata that is always exported using UIDs. Please check the individual endpoint issues/docs for specifics.

Support of different idSchemes is added to {{/tracker/trackedEntities}} and {{/tracker/events}} endpoints.

Feature card

issues.summary: Spring Framework Upgrades
issues.creator: Marta Vila

issues.description:
## Release notes description

Ongoing upgrades to the Spring framework ensure that the security of DHIS2 is maintained. During this release the engineering team has performed an upgrade to Spring 6, upgrade Spring Security, and integrated Spring Authorisation Server which enables for many improvements like implementing mutil-factor authentication in the DHIS2 Android App, or api tokens, which will enhance custom app security and access control, amongs others.

Documentation | Feature card | Screenshot 1 | 2 | 3

issues.summary: Add the org unit hierarchy when running validation rule, outlier and follow-up analysis
issues.creator: Shurajit Dutta
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

*I am trying to find the origin of a DQ issue identified in the data quality application via validaiton rules, outliers and follow-up analysis.*

As a **[DHIS2 user]**

When - *I run validation rule analysis, outlier analysis, follow-up analysis*

I want to - *Be able to identify the OU hierarchy*

So I can - *Easily find the facility the issue is from*

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

*Countries that use the data quality app. This is an issue at higher levels of the system (national, regional, provincial, etc.) as they may not be aware of the location of a facility, and they have no other option to find it easily.*

### How do they solve these problems today?

*They may go to data entry or maintenance, type in the facility, and then be able to identify the hierarchy that way. That is time consuming however.*

!image-20250422-163519.png|width=1356,height=628,alt="image-20250422-163519.png"!

## 

!image-20250422-163615.png|width=648,height=805,alt="image-20250422-163615.png"!

issues.summary: "Days after period to qualify for timely submission" and "Expiry days" supports number type values
issues.creator: Karoline Tufte Lien
issues.customfield_10194: When specifying the parameters for a data set, you can now use numbers (eg 0.5) for the "Days after period to qualify for timely submission" and ‚ÄúExpiry days‚Äù.
issues.description:
## Release notes description

When specifying the parameters for a data set, you can now use numbers (eg 0.5) for the "Days after period to qualify for timely submission" and ‚ÄúExpiry days‚Äù. This will support IDSR use cases where timely submission for weekly IDSR data is Monday at 12 (noon), which is 0.5 days after period end on Sunday midnight.

With DHIS2 increasingly being used for IDSR where rapid reporting etc are a must, this change will increasingly be used to set timeliness requirements less than one day, or in some cases e.g. 1.5 days.  Historically this parameter has been mostly used for timeliness of "long transaction" monthly aggregated data (the term "long transaction" is a term used for data processes that take considerable time - in the DHIS2 case typically 5-20 days after the end of the month). Disease surveillance data is different, because rapid submission of e.g. outbreak data is of vital importance for the early containment of epidemics. Such data is also increasingly being submitted directly from health facilities or clinicians, using browsers or the Android Capture app.

Documentation | [Feature card](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/releases/screenshots/42/42-collect-timely-submission.png) | Screenshot 1 | 2 | 3

issues.summary: Event deletion
issues.creator: Delphine Pastorel
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### **What problem or job are we going after?**

As a DHIS2 user I shouldn't have the option to delete an event in active or completed status.

Context: we are using the DHIS2 capture app. On the web form, users shouldn't have the option to delete an event in active or completed status

The event is mandatory for all users, so we want to avoid losing the data. We do not need to have a Delete option on the event level.

Steps to reproduce the issue:

** Create a case

** Open case home page

** Click on 3 dots next to any section

** See if you have a Delete option

!image-20250331-161347.png|width=422,height=180,alt="image-20250331-161347.png"!

**Who faces this problem and how important is it to them?**

The solution will be used globally. It is important to avoid losing data.

**How do they solve these problems today?**

We do not have a workaround today - besides users' training

issues.summary: Capture app multilingual support
issues.creator: Delphine Pastorel
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### **What problem or job are we going after?**

*As a DHIS2 user I should see the feedback section translated in the selected user language.*

Context: we are using the DHIS2 capture app and the feedback section does not support multilingual translation.

Steps to reproduce the issue:

1. Log in as emergency care and first aid responder
1. Open the capture app
1. Select the Individual Response Form
1. Select the Org Unit
1. Create a new enrollment
1. Edit the profile

!image-20250331-152752.png|width=454,height=143,alt="image-20250331-152752.png"!

The timestamps labels in the screenshot above should support translation so that the user sees the information displayed in the selected language.

**Who faces this problem and how important is it to them?**

The solution will be used globally. It is important that the app supports multiple languages so that users can understand the information displayed.

**How do they solve these problems today?**

We do not have any workaround for this today.

issues.summary: Timezone support
issues.creator: Delphine Pastorel
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.

## üí≠ Problem definition

### **What problem or job are we going after?**

As a DHIS2 user, I should see the time displayed in the correct time zone. ¬†

Context: For the pre-hospital care response app, which will be used to manage ambulance services, we are using the DHIS2 capture app, and the hours displayed on the server differ from the hours selected by the user in the timer.

Steps to reproduce the issue:

1. Log in as emergency care and first aid responder
1. Open the capture app
1. Select the Individual Response Form

1. Edit the profile
1. Complete the timestamps

!image-20250331-123945.png|width=454,height=143,alt="image-20250331-123945.png"!
!image-20250331-124112.png|width=371,height=189,alt="image-20250331-124112.png"!

**How do they solve these problems today?**

*We do not have any workaround for this today.*

issues.summary: Scheduled events should have a scheduled time (or datetime for due date)
issues.creator: Brian O'Donnell
issues.description:
Facilities with high patient load and staffing burden could benefit from scheduling appointments by time of day, and not just by date. If dhis2 is the patient registry in such a context, the Scheduled Event could be considered a patient appointment. 

But currently a scheduled event just has the due date; if you add another data element with a time variable, then the event is no longer scheduled but active.

This would be a roadblock to building an appointment management tool on top of dhis2.

issues.summary: Replace ANTLR with PEG expression parser
issues.creator: Karoline Tufte Lien

The new 'PEG' expression parser is currently only used for program rules. ([https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/ROADMAP-33](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/ROADMAP-33) )

The ANTLR parser is still used in the backend for indicators, program indicators, validation rules, and predictors. We want to migrate from ANTLR to PEG for the rest of the backend expressions and retire the ANTLR parser completely.

issues.summary: External Dashboard types - Superset
issues.creator: Karoline Tufte Lien
issues.customfield_10194: This functionality implements support for embedding external Superset dashboards in our core dashboards app.
issues.description:
## Release notes description

DHIS2 now supports displaying external dashboards through the bundled Dashboard app. This allows dashboards served from other platforms to appear side-by-side with standard DHIS2 dashboards. The first supported external dashboard type is Superset, using a connector contributed by BAO Systems.

[Feature card](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/releases/screenshots/42/42-extend-external-dashboards.png) | [Superset Connector](https://bitbucket.org/baosystems/dhis2-superset-gateway)

issues.summary: Maps: Period selector for thematic layers
issues.creator: Karoline Tufte Lien
issues.customfield_10194: The Period tab within thematic layers has been completely redesigned to improve flexibility and clarity.
issues.description:
## Release notes description

The Period tab has been completely redesigned to improve flexibility and clarity:

** It now uses the same period selector as other analytics apps, allowing selection of multiple periods and support for non-Gregorian calendars.
** All Maps now handle multiple periods selections, including mixed selections of different period types, fixed and/or relative presets.
** Start and End Date inputs use the new standard calendar with improved data entry mask, which supports translations (currently limited to the Gregorian calendar).
** Mapping options (Single, Timeline, or Split Map) are now more clearly displayed with icons and improved information messages.

[Documentation](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/use/user-guides/dhis-core-version-master/analysing-data/maps.html#create-a-thematic-layer) | [Feature card](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/releases/screenshots/42/42-analyze-maps-functional-improvements.png)

issues.summary: Support for customized tracker terminology v2
issues.creator: Karoline Tufte Lien
issues.customfield_10194: DHIS2 now allows customizing tracker terminology like "event" and "enrollment" for end users' familiarity. Admins can configure it per program via the Maintenance App, and the Android Capture App reflects these custom terms.
issues.description:
Some DHIS2 terminology is not familiar for the end users. For this reason, we are gradually enabling the possibility to customize it to each particular use case. In this version, the term "event" and "enrollment" are customizable. The admin user will be able to configure it for each program using the Maintenance App, and the Android Capture App will display the customized term instead of the generic one.

2.10 implemented:

** Enrollment (25 strings)
** Event
** Program Stage ()

Future version will include

** Registering unit
** Follow-up
** Attribute
** Relationships
** Notes

issues.summary: Display only relevant periods for data analysis
issues.creator: Marc Pratllus√†
issues.description:
When creating a map, chart or table I want to know what periods are relevant for the selected data item.

This might be more of an observation than a bug, but it‚Äôs not easy to understand why sometimes there is data, and other times there is not.
This seems to be related to choosing relative periods (for example last 14 days) when the data set is capturing monthly data. This is also confusing when selecting fixed periods, 1.12.2024 to 31.12.2024 and seeing data for the month, but when selecting a period that does not cover first to last day of the month, data is not shown. 

Another example of confusion is, if I select the 1st until the 30th of November 2024, data shows up, but if I select a relative period of the last 60 days (which includes the whole November 2024), no data is shown.

I‚Äôm guessing there‚Äôs a reasonable explanation for that, but as a first time user of the Map app, it‚Äôs hard to figure out why.

issues.summary: Integrate Resource Feature from Web Reports into DHIS2 Android App
issues.creator: Mamadou Tafsir Diallo
issues.description:
**Component**: Android App
**Type**: New Feature
**Description**:
In the DHIS2 web version, the **Reports** > **Resource** feature allows us to store useful documents and links, which can then be embedded in dashboards for users to access. For example, in one of our dashboards, we provide links to various tutorials and user guides to help users better navigate and utilize DHIS2. These links lead to external resources, such as training material hosted on other platforms.
We would like to request the integration of a similar feature into the DHIS2 Android app. This would enable app users to access documentation, tutorials, or short videos directly from their mobile devices. The goal is to provide the same level of support and training resources for mobile users as we currently do for web users.
**Proposed Features:**

** **Resource Repository:** A section in the Android app where documentation, links, or videos can be attached and accessed.
** **Dashboard Integration:** The ability to display and link these resources from within dashboards in the app.
** **Offline Access :** An option to download specific resources for offline use.
Impact:
This feature would greatly enhance user experience and ensure that DHIS2 app users have the necessary support and training resources at their fingaertips, fostering better adoption and utilization of the platform.
**Steps to Reproduce (current behavior):**
** Navigate to the DHIS2 web version.
** Go to **Reports** > **Resource** and store links/documents.
** Observe that these resources are not accessible from the Android app.
Thank you for considering this feature request!

issues.summary: Program Rules: Action to Delete Scheduled Messages
issues.creator: Muhammad Salihu
issues.description:
As a DHIS2 implementer, I need the ability to delete scheduled messages using program rules when certain conditions are no longer met. This feature would enhance the flexibility and responsiveness of our notification system within DHIS2.

Current Situation:

Currently, DHIS2 allows scheduling messages through program rules using the "SCHEDULEMESSAGE" action. However, there is no direct way to delete these scheduled messages using program rules when conditions change.

Proposed Solution:

Implement a new program rule action type called "DELETESCHEDULEDMESSAGE" that allows the deletion of previously scheduled messages based on specified criteria.

Detailed Requirements:

1. Add a new action type "DELETESCHEDULEDMESSAGE" to the list of available program rule actions.

1. The action should accept parameters to identify which scheduled message(s) to delete, such as:

** Program

** Program Stage (optional)

** Data element or attribute that triggered the original scheduled message

** Original scheduled date range (if applicable)

1. When the program rule condition evaluates to true, the action should remove any matching scheduled messages from the system.

1. Provide appropriate error handling and logging for cases where no matching scheduled messages are found.

Use Case Examples:

In a maternal health program, a message is scheduled when a pregnant woman's hemoglobin level is below a certain threshold. If a subsequent test shows improved levels, we need to cancel the previously scheduled follow-up message.

In a TB contact tracing program where data entry forms are strictly configured not to allow scheduling events, a message is scheduled when contacts are referred to a health facility and have not appeared at the health facility after 7 days. If the contact subsequently appear before the 7th day, the previously scheduled notification need to be deleted.

Technical Considerations:

** This feature would likely require modifications to the program rule engine, notification schedules and the messaging subsystem.

** Consider performance implications of searching for scheduled messages to delete.

- Ensure proper access control so that only authorized program rules can delete scheduled messages.

Benefits:

1. Improved accuracy of notifications sent to patients and health workers.

1. Reduced manual intervention required to manage scheduled messages.

1. Enhanced ability to create dynamic, condition-based communication workflows.

Additional Information:

This feature request is based on community discussions and the need for more flexible message management in DHIS2 programs. It aligns with the existing capabilities of scheduling messages through program rules and would complete the lifecycle management of these notifications.

Please let me know if you need any additional information or clarification on this feature request.

issues.summary: Option to shorten week names in visualizations

issues.summary: Dashboard Groups (UX, Sharing, etc.)
issues.creator: Raphael Kenyuri
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

As a **DHIS2 user** responsible for managing and organizing dashboards within the system,

**When** I access the dashboard section to view or manage dashboards in various categories,

**I want to** see dashboards organized into specific groups and only display dashboards from a selected group, hashtag various dashboard based on the project or program.

**So I can** quickly navigate and focus on dashboards relevant to my current task or area of interest, without the clutter of unrelated dashboards.

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

This issue is faced by DHIS2 users across various roles, including administrators, program officers, data analysts, and health workers in multiple countries. It‚Äôs especially important for large organizations or country implementations where there are numerous dashboards for different programs, projects, or regions. These users need efficient dashboard organization to enhance usability, improve workflow efficiency, and reduce the cognitive load of finding the right dashboards for specific tasks.

### How do they solve these problems today?

Currently, users work around this limitation by using naming conventions to group dashboards or manually scrolling through the dashboard list to locate the relevant one. This can be time-consuming, especially in implementations with a high volume of dashboards. Additionally, users may rely on keeping lists of dashboard names, but these approaches are neither efficient nor scalable in environments with complex dashboard structures.

issues.summary: Org Units Favorites Feature Request
issues.creator: Raphael Kenyuri
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

The goal is to enhance user experience in the DHIS2 data entry process by providing a way to mark specific organization units as "favorites." This feature will allow users to quickly access frequently used organization units, improving efficiency and reducing time spent searching through extensive lists.

**As a DHIS2 user**

**When** I am entering data within DHIS2 and need to select an organization unit.

**I want to** be able to mark specific organization units as favorites and have these appear at the top of the selection list.

**So, I can** access my most-used organization units quickly, without needing to scroll through a long list each time.

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

This problem is commonly faced by DHIS2 data entry users, particularly those working in large health systems with complex organizational structures and many layers of organization units.

For these users, being able to quickly select their commonly used organization units is critical, as it can streamline their workflow, save time, and reduce frustration. This feature would be especially valuable in high-usage contexts where users repeatedly enter data for the same set of organization units, as it would help them perform their tasks more efficiently.

### How do they solve these problems today?

Currently, users manually search through the full list of organization units each time they enter data. In cases with extensive hierarchies, this requires scrolling and searching, which can be time-consuming and error prone.

## üí≠ Problem definition

### **Use case (context)**

Storekeepers use the DHIS2-RTS Capture Android app for recording stock transactions in real-time but are not integrated with an upstream, national eLMIS such as Medexis, mSupply or OpenLMIS.

For detailed Business requirements please refer to:

Chapter 2.2 Iteration 3: additional transactions

in the document: ‚ÄúReal-Time Stock Management Tool DHIS2 module, Iteration 3, Business requirements‚Äù

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1*lLGMqgFHW9ZklUQHtS8NHXSMTsP1YflJI20RYwN4hs/edit](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1*lLGMqgFHW9ZklUQHtS8NHXSMTsP1YflJI20RYwN4hs/edit) 

This roadmap issue replaces Roadmap-307 (which was deleted on 21.10.2024.

**As a DHIS2 user**, a storekeeper in the pharmacy of a healthcare facility

**When** - entering and recording stock transactions in the DHIS2-RTS Capture Android app

**I want to** - be able to record transactions other than Distribution, Discard and Stock correction of stocks

**So I can** - also record:

** Stock receipts

** Stock replenishment orders

** Transfers

** Returns

** Provided loans

** Returned loans

** Lost sales

**Who faces this problem**

Store keepers and project managers implementing LMIS systems

**How do they solve these problems today?*

Stock receipts and automatic stock replenishment order calculation (VMI) can be achieved through integration with a national, upstream LMIS but such as system may not be available.

Other transactions are not recorded at all or recorded in a paper record.

issues.summary: Use Tracker Data element values for in program rule
issues.creator: George McGuire
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## **Use case (context)**

This calculation is required for the future DHIS2-RTS transaction which allows calculating a recommended order quantity for replenishing healthcare facilities. This feature is required if the either DHIS2 is not integrated with an upstream, national eLMIS which therefore cannot automatically calculate replenishment orders using the VMI (Vendor Managed Inventory) concept or if stakeholders refuse to use VMI for stock replenishment and want the healthcare facilities to decide on stock replenishment orders.

The required calculation is in principle simple:

Average distributions of the past 90 days, multiplied with a fixed factor (for example 3) from which then the stock on hand is subtracted.

The distribution quantities of each transaction are recorded in DHIS2-RTS as a separate event and a quantity in the "Distribution" Data element (Tracker data element).

The stock on hand is also available in the DHIS2-RTS as another Data element (Last value)

The functionality which is missing and required is allowing the user to:

** use a Program indicator in a program rule, or

** configure a new d2: function which allows aggregating the Data element values of a Tracker program event across a defined period (for example the last 90 days)

**As a DHIS2 user**, storekeeper in a healthcare facility using DHIS2-RTS for recording transactions.

**When** - prepare the (monthly) stock replenishment order

**I want to** - review an automated calculation in DHIS2-RTS

**So I can** - order according to a sound, systematic and rational inventory control policy

**Who faces this problem**

Any storekeeper who needs to place a (monthly) order using the DHIS2-RTS application

**How do they solve these problems today?**

Manual calculation on paper, with a calculator or a spreadsheet.

issues.summary: Administrator setting for forcing synchronisation during login/logout
issues.creator: George McGuire
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### **Context and use case**

At a healthcare facilities more than one user, each with their own credentials, are using the DHIS2-RTS app. The storekeepers work in shifts and change day by day. Every storekeeper must use the most recent stock on hand data from the storekeeper on the previous shift or who worked on the previous day. However, currently the Capture Android app data is cached by user/instance/device which means that every storekeeper would be using the stock data from their previous shift, even if it was days or even weeks ago (in case of sick leave or holidays). This means that any stock on hand which was changed by any other user between two logins of a certain user, will always be wrong for every user. Two work arounds are available but are both not ideal for different reasons.

**As a DHIS2 administrator**

**When** ‚Äì implementing DHIS2-RTS (Real-Time Stock management tool) anywhere

**I want to** ‚Äì force mobile devices to synchronise (only) the DHIS2-RTS Tracker program during login and logout

**So the next user ‚Äì** will use the correct and most recent stock position (of the user which was previously logged in) and not the stock position of the user who is logging in. This user might have logged in the last time days ago (or even weeks ago in case of sick leave or holidays) and the cached stock position will be completely outdated.

**Who faces the problem**

This problem was encountered during the current DHIS2-RTS implementation (September 2024) in the Comoros but all DHIS2-RTS implementations are affected.

All users are affected by this problem and if there is more than one user using the same mobile device, the stock position will always be wrong for all users. To be precise: any stock on hand which was changed by any other user between the login of a certain user, will be wrong.

**Workaround**

The problem can be avoided by ensuring that all users synchronises the mobile device right after logging in and right before logging out. However, sooner or later a user will forget. Morever, the Internet connection is not always available and if a user cannot synchronise data before going home, s/he will not wait for the Internet to return.

The current solution is to simply ask all users to use the same credentials which is not ideal from a security point of view.

**Proposed feature**

The DHIS2 Administrator has the option of ‚Äúforcing‚Äù the synchronisation for a specific Program after login and during logout in the Android-settings app which gives users a choice.

issues.summary: One-Question-at-a-Time Viewing in DHIS2 Android Capture app
issues.creator: Clement Bempong Danso
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

I have a data entry form where data collectors need to enter responses for various questions. However, I have observed that presenting the entire form at once can be overwhelming and may lead to data entry errors. 

To enhance the user experience and improve data accuracy, I propose a feature that allows data collectors to view and respond to one question at a time, with the ability to navigate to the next question by swiping. This approach would help maintain focus on each question, reduce cognitive load, and ensure that data collectors can complete the forms efficiently and accurately.

**Use Case:** **Expected Behavior:**

** **Single-Question Display:** When a data entry form is opened in the Android app, only one question should be displayed at a time.
** **Swipe Navigation:** Data collectors should be able to swipe left or right to move to the next or previous question, respectively.
** **Progress Indicator:** A progress bar or a question number indicator at the top or bottom of the screen would help users track their progress through the form.
** **Data Validation:** As each question is answered, the app should validate the input before allowing the user to proceed to the next question. If there is an error, an appropriate message should be displayed.
** **Review Mode:* After completing all the questions, data collectors should have the option to review their answers before final submission, either by swiping through the questions again or by viewing a summary screen.

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

*This is faced by the DHIS2 Android Capture users (field workers).*

### How do they solve these problems today?

*There‚Äôs not currently a way round this in DHIS2*

This feature would greatly enhance the data collection process, particularly in scenarios where attention to detail is critical. I believe it would be a valuable addition to the DHIS2 Android app and would be appreciated by many users in the field.

issues.summary: Option to have "data not accessible/not assessed/not reliable enough" for the data elements
issues.creator: Clemence
issues.description:
### **What is the rationale?**

In the data entry application, users are filling in data elements but they are not able to select that the data is not available. They have to either leave it empty or put 0, which in both ways are wrong in terms data analysis and data quality. We should be able to state in our analysis that our data is not available/not accessible/not reliable enough and have the validation rules checking that an action was done for each data elements: either a number/answer should appear, or the box should be clicked. When looking at the analytics, that would give the users/epidemiologists the information on how reliable the visualization is (e.g. 20% of entry were done for this data element).

**How would it look like?**

We should be able to configure this functionality for each data elements of the data entry app: ¬†¬†Option of having a tick box which would grey and disable the data entry instead of leaving the box empty.

**Who faces this problem and how important it is to them?**

All the ICRC users are facing this problem today. We have moved from a Lotus Note application to DHIS2 and this function was very important for the health data analysis when looking at the aggregation of data / analytics. We do work with partners in our operations, and we do collect data from them, and we therefore need to be able to assess if the data that we have is not reliable. This is part of our analysis.

**Conclusion:**

This feature would be a valuable enhancement that will greatly benefit users, particularly within the ICRC, by making the data entry more reliable and the analysis more efficient.

issues.summary: Implement Wild Card Search and Best Match Functionality in DHIS2 Data Entry App/ Data Visualizer for Organisation Units
issues.creator: Mamadou Tafsir Diallo
issues.description:
**Description:**

We propose the addition of wild card search and best match functionality within the DHIS2 Data Entry app to improve the efficiency and user experience of searching for organization units.

**Rationale:**

The current search functionality in the DHIS2 Data Entry/ Data visualizer app does not support wild card searches or best match results, which can hinder users' ability to quickly and accurately find specific organization units. Implementing these features will streamline the search process, reducing the time and effort required for data entry.

1. Key Benefits:

1. Enhanced User Experience:
#** Users will be able to perform more flexible and intuitive searches, increasing satisfaction and productivity.
1. Improved Efficiency:
#** The ability to use wild card searches and view best match results will reduce the time spent searching for organization units, allowing users to complete data entry tasks more quickly.
1. Greater Accuracy:
#** Best match functionality will help users find the most relevant organization units, reducing the likelihood of errors.

1. Scope and Requirements:

1. Wild Card Search:
#** Implement wild card search capabilities to allow partial matches. For example, searching for "Hosp**" should return all organization units that start with "Hosp".
1. Best Match Results:
#** Introduce an algorithm to rank search results based on relevance, displaying the best matches at the top of the list.
1. User Interface Adjustments:
#** Modify the search interface to accommodate and display these new search features clearly.

1. ICRC Specific Needs:

** The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) manages a large number of organization units. This vast hierarchy makes it challenging for users, especially those at higher levels, to find specific facilities quickly.
** Variations in language and the use of accents or special characters can lead to inconsistencies in the names of organization units, further complicating the search process. For example, a facility's name might differ slightly depending on the language or presence of accented characters, making it difficult to locate using the current search functionality.
** Implementing wild card searches and best match results will greatly assist our users by accommodating these variations and improving the accuracy and speed of their searches.

Potential Impact:

While the initial implementation may require adjustments in the backend search algorithms and interface design, the long-term benefits in terms of improved search efficiency and user satisfaction are significant. This feature will also position DHIS2 as a more user-friendly platform, potentially attracting more users and use cases.

**Conclusion:**

We believe that adding wild card search and best match functionality to the DHIS2 Data Entry app is a valuable enhancement that will greatly benefit users, particularly within the ICRC, by making the search process more efficient and accurate. We request that this feature be considered for inclusion in the DHIS2 roadmap.

issues.summary: Style null values using legend
issues.creator: Luigi Nu√±ez
issues.description:
The request is to make it possible to style null values using legend. Currently, only cells with data are highlighted when using a legend.

Here is a thread on the community of practice:

[https://community.dhis2.org/t/legends-and-pivot-tables-is-it-possible-to-style-a-null-value-using-a-legend/57327/5](https://community.dhis2.org/t/legends-and-pivot-tables-is-it-possible-to-style-a-null-value-using-a-legend/57327/5) 

## User Story

As an M&E, I would like to be able to assign a color to null values when creating a legend that is to be used in a pivot table, so that I can easily identify where there is no data at all as opposed to having blank spaces in the table. This is especially so when working with program indicators, where there is no tracker/event data at all, the cell is left as a blank rather than have a zero. I would like to have the option of assigning this blank/null cell a color when creating the legend.

## Acceptance Criteria

When creating a legend, a user should be able to assign a color for null values as well (just like in maps). This way, if a user creates a pivot table and assigns it this legend, the cells which are blank/null will have the assigned color.

issues.summary: Enhance Validation Rule Report summary: link to data entry, use instruction over description
issues.creator: Blake Hansen
issues.description:
Understanding that space is a premium in a validation report UI, I think it would be helpful for two additional pieces of information to be prioritised in the output report that would **vastly** improve the usefulness of this report. (I am thinking the inclusion of this info is either in addition or in preference over existing info in the table. For example, the ‚Äúpriority‚Äù column could be taken out, and the report be grouped by section of high, medium, low, validation rules that could be expanded/collapsed by priority; and that would save the width of one column right away.) 

!image-20240612-114442.png|width=100%,alt="image-20240612-114442.png"!

*The curent validation rule analysis screen* missing *these key features.*

These new features are:

** Instruction: this property is where we should be inputting the action a user should be taking (based on how it is used in the data entry app also) - in this report it would serve two purposes which are crucial. 1. It would help a user understand why the validation is showing in the first place (the name may not do that, which is in the table, so this is helpful extra context to help them know why the problem matters.) 2. It tells them what action should then be taken. 
** A link back to the data entry screen where rectification can then be taken to fix the value.
**** If there is concern that a user with authority to run a validation analysis shouldn‚Äôt also be changing data - I‚Äôd suggest a toggle-able feature based upon the user authority for also being able to enter data.

Thank you - I think these two additions would be valuable. (In the interests of keeping this issue alive, let‚Äôs not say if you think one idea is good and one is bad, that both get thrown out - please adapt the issue. Ideally both would be good üòâ )

issues.summary: System setting to reduce restrictiveness of analytics dimension restrictions
issues.creator: Ben Guaraldi
issues.description:
Currently, if a user has an analytics dimension restriction, they cannot see anything that has an attribute option combination that is not within the dimension they are restricted by.¬† For example, if a user is restricted by the project dimension, they cannot see anything that is associated with any agency, donor, partner, or even the default attribute option combo.

We'd like to add a system setting that makes these dimension restrictions a little less restrictive.¬† It could be called, "Users with analytics dimension restrictions can see data outside those dimensions," with the current state being off.¬† Off is also the default state.

If the setting is turned on, then the user that is restricted by the project dimension would be able to see all things that are not related to the project category.¬† Also, for a category combo of project and partner, they'd be able to see any data associated with any partner, as long as it's associated with their project.

issues.summary: Unified query language to align Line Lists with Program Indicators
issues.creator: Austin McGee
issues.description:
We support an interface for defining line list queries, and separately a language for defining program indicators.  We should unify this - support a query language (not necessarily the program indicator language) which can apply to both, allowing users to navigate back-and-forth between lists and indicators.

We should look to CQL and other query languages for inspiration, and might even be able to use an existing implementation.

issues.summary: Translation packs for app interfaces (languages and terminology)
issues.creator: Austin McGee
issues.description:
Some users are blocked from using apps due to translations:

** Translations can be missing, incomplete, or incorrect for a desired language
** There can also be domain-specific language that‚Äôs desired for a particular app, e.g. ‚ÄúPatient‚Äù for Health or ‚ÄúStudent‚Äù for Education

Enabling users to upload custom translations that can be used in their instance‚Äôs UI can unblock them and decouple their needs from the Transifex translation workflow.

issues.description: Apps should be able to define custom ‚Äúcommands‚Äù which can be accessed through the command pallet.  An example of this is creating a ‚ÄúDefine‚Ä¶‚Äù command which allows the user to look up any metadata object from anywhere in DHIS2 and view a definition of that object in an overlay.

issues.summary: Metadata versioning
issues.creator: Austin McGee

issues.summary: Workflow-based platform entrypoint for accessing all DHIS2 functionality

issues.description: De-emphasize apps as the main entrypoint for DHIS2 users, starting from either ‚Äúcapture‚Äù or ‚Äúanalyze‚Äù (for example)

Currently, documentation links in apps go to the online [docs.dhis2.org](http://docs.dhis2.org) site which (1) might not be accessible in offline situations, (2) might be difficult to understand / parse for end-users, (3) might not be relevant to a particular implementation

Instead, we should support bundling ‚Äúhelp‚Äù material within the implementation itself.

If a tree falls in the forest does it make a sound?

Client-side errors often go unreported and cause friction to use of the system, but must be manually reported to server administrators

issues.summary: Batched API requests across the network
issues.creator: Austin McGee
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Support for performing multiple (read-only) API requests in a single network round-trip, similar to the way GraphQL works.

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

This has the potential to significantly improve the perceived performance of DHIS2 web (and Android) applications.

## ‚ùì Problem Description

When loading DHIS2 into a web browser, many hundreds of network requests are sometimes made to the core API

## ü§î¬†Assumptions

We assume that this can be done without significantly refactoring the backend (i.e. as a facade in front of the existing API)

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

This is a technical improvement to address performance issues

## (!)¬†Out of Scope

Initially this will only support read queries

## (?)¬†Open Questions

|**Question**|**Answer**|**Date Answered**|
|Should we try to do this within DHIS2 itself, rather than with an external API Gateway service?| | |

issues.summary: Row-based data entry interface for secondary data entry
issues.creator: Olav Poppe
issues.description:
## Confluence

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/wiki/x/AQADJ](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/wiki/x/AQADJ)

 

## High level use case and user¬¥s description

----

**High level use case:** better data entry interfaces for tracker implementations where secondary data entry is done (i.e. most)

**Users:** tracker data entry users

## The problem you are trying to solve

----

Most tracker data entry is secondary. The wide use of custom forms for aggregate data sets indicate that replicating the format/structure of the source document is the preferred way to do data entry from paper forms.

The current Capture app does not support this. First, custom forms are not supported, so attributes/data elements are always organised vertically with one field per row. Second, data entry is organised according to the design of the data model (i.e. attributes separately, forms split according to program stages).

Tracker data entry generally happens based on paper forms of two types:

** Line lists, where each row represents one event or one TEI + one enrollment + one or more events
** Case/patient forms, where each form (e.g. A4 forms of one or more pages) represents one event or one TEI + one enrollment + one or more events

This proposal is to support data entry interfaces for these two use cases.

In both cases, it should be possible to design the form/line list independent of whether fields are attributes, enrollment dates, event dates or data elements. It should be possible to use a single data entry field to represent multiple variables (for example, a ‚Äúregistration date‚Äù field could be used both as enrollment date and event date for a particular stage).

The line list functionality should be reviewed against the plans for editable working lists. However, unless the whole process (enrollment, multiple events etc) can be done, editable working lists do not elleviate the need for a line list interface.

## The source of inputs

Need for line list/tabular data entry interface was discussed during C19, it is mention in [+capture app user stories+](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1U72P63ZJW-5PuZBqYCSuO9lj95YLm8dQ4-kFznjVTn8/edit#gid=773129706), and there have been community apps that do this for events. This is primarily based on reflecting over and discussing the current situation in countries and how we support that.¬†

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-11415](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-11415) For EMIS, there is a need to have a user interface where one can easily pick a list of students and enter limited data for a specific stage. Typical use cases (as shown in the attached screenshots) are term grades for one or more subjects and attendance (in some cases rather absence).¬†¬†

!image-20250721-133919.png|width=198,height=317,alt="image-20250721-133919.png"!

## The boundaries within which we should be analyzing (optional)

----

The proposal is *not* about replacing the Capture app, which has much additional functionality beyond just data entry, but to complement it with more efficient and user-friendly ways of doing secondary data entry. Notably, since this is just about having a dedicated UI for data entry, implementations can combine or replace this with PoC data entry as they are ready; the underlying data model/configuration remains as today, and Capture can be used as today.

issues.summary: Data table component improvements, extensions
issues.creator: Joe Cooper

** Search

** Advanced selections
** Hiding closed/inactive org units

issues.creator: Joe Cooper
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

*State the problem you‚Äôre trying to solve.  You can frame this as a job-to-be-done:*

As a **[DHIS2 user]**

When - *my session expires.*

I want to -  *be informed of this and easily log back in,*

So I can - *continue with my work without losing any data.*

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

*All users who work on a system with an automatic timeout configured*

### How do they solve these problems today?

*Trying to remember not to get logged out, refresh page (risk of data loss) to check if still signed in.*

##

issues.summary: App-specific settings in a central location
issues.creator: Joe Cooper
issues.description:
## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

State the problem you‚Äôre trying to solve.  You can frame this as a job-to-be-done:

As a **[DHIS2 user]**

When - I need to adjust settings for a DHIS2 app.

I want to - find and have access to app settings in a single, central location.

So I can - quickly and easily know where to configure apps on my system.

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

Any user that wants to configure or customise a DHIS2 app.

Important to help instances make locally relevant customisations.

### How do they solve these problems today?

Digging around in different places in different apps to find configurations, searching documentation, asking on COP.

##

issues.summary: Universal object search
issues.creator: Joe Cooper
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

*State the problem you‚Äôre trying to solve.  You can frame this as a job-to-be-done:*

As a **[DHIS2 user]**

When - *I need to navigate to another object in the DHIS2 system (like a chart, line list, or data element).*

I want to - *search for the object wherever I am in DHIS2, without needing to open a specific app first.*

So I can - *find things and navigate DHIS2 more efficiently (decoupled from the app model).*

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

** *Power users who work across multiple apps regularly*
** *Non-power users who do not have a conceptual understanding of the DHIS2 app model who just want to find a certain chart, table, or line list.*

### How do they solve these problems today?

*Keeping a mental note of which app they need to use to open certain objects. Trial and error.*

##

As a **[DHIS2 user]**

When - I am using assistive technology

I want to - have reasonable access to DHIS2 functionality

So I can - do my work.

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

Users around the world that use assistive technology.

issues.creator: Marta Vila

issues.summary: Improve DHIS2 Calculation of completeness rate to Exclude Weekends and Holidays
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
## üí≠ Problem definition

Currently, DHIS2 calculates completion rates taking into account all days, including weekends and public holidays. However, it has been identified that this approach can lead to inaccurate figures in EMIS, as weekends and public holidays should ideally be excluded from the calculation. Especially when you are collecting daily attendance data. As a consequence completeness rate can never be 100% even though data has been collected all the school days. Please find attached a screenshot of completeness rate for daily attendance

**Benefits:**

1. Improved accuracy of completion rate calculations, providing more meaningful insights into attendance patterns.
1. Better alignment of completion rate calculations with actual attendance data.
1. Enhanced usability for organizations that require precise attendance analytics.

issues.summary: Climate/enviromental Layers in DHIS2 Maps
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Use this template to describe the problem, as well as why it matters, and to share information who can add their insights.
{panel}

## üí≠ Problem definition

### What problem or job are we going after?

*Many use cases need additional external data sets for triangulation with clinical data.* 

The additional data sources include:

** Temperature/thermal (60m) and precipitation from ERA5 - Land (PR Ready)

** Air pollution (NOx, SO2, CO, PM2.5, PM10, O3, ect) from Copernicus
** Satellite imagery (before and after flooding etc.)
** Landcover (hyper spectral 30m) from NASA Earth Observation
- Hydrologic modeling (5km) from Goddard SFC / NASA Earth Observation

### Who faces this problem and how important is it to them? 

*Implementers of campaign planning and early warning systems*

How do they solve these problems today?

*Exporting data out of DHIS2 and performing spatial analysis and triangulation in ArcGIS or QGIS*

##

This could also be a parameter for the dashboard editor to select as part of the edit page.

issues.summary: New Event Reports & Event Visualizer App
issues.creator: Scott Russpatrick
issues.description:
New functionality can no longer be added to the ER or EV applications as the user experience for those application is well below DHIS2 modern standards. 

The new application would include pivot tables and charts based upon tracked entity data and all tracker dimensions (various period and org units). 

This will give us the foundation on which to build new tracker specific chart types such as network graphs, scatter plots, relationship trees, etc. and it will allow us to make aggregations of tracked entities and events in a more dynamic way lessening the burden for many program indicators.

issues.summary: Improvements to Data Approval App including adding AOCs
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
## üí≠ Problem definition

Add CategoryCombo to DataApprovalWorkflow in the backend.

The flyway script to update the database should initially populate this field from the CategoryCombo field of one of the DataSets (if any) referencing this workflow. If there are no DataSets referencing the workflow, the default CategoryCombo should be assigned.

This is a current data model weakness. Data approvals are designed so that attribute option combinations are approved for all the data sets belonging to a data approval workflow. But there is no specification in the workflow as to which CategoryCombo these attribute option combinations are based on, and no check that the DataSets in a workflow will all have the same CategoryCombo.

issues.summary: Analysis of text option sets together
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
## üí≠ Problem definition

There is a need to be able to analyze text value types captured through the aggregate domain.

Education tools usually have both aggregate numbers and some dropdowns (Annual School Census, Termly Tool, School Feeding tool). For example, one section captures enrolment numbers (with disaggregations), and another captures condition of infrastructure using a drop-down (in good condition, needs minor repair, needs major repair).

Using tracker domain type to capture this kind of data would not be ideal since category combos would best support the disaggregations for enrolment, repeaters, staff, etc. While within the aggregate domain, there are analysis challenges with the fields that require text value types to be able to use¬†drop-downs.

issues.summary: Multiple active enrolments for the same TEI under different organisation units
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Within the education space, the same teacher can be employed by more than one school (organization unit). It is also possible for the same student to go to more than one school.

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

SEMIS users

## ‚ùì Problem Description

Within the education space, the same teacher can be employed by more than one school (organization unit). It is also possible for the same student to go to more than one school.

As such, there is a need to be able to have them registered under both schools concurrently to ensure accurate calculation of some key education indicators.

This would therefore necessitate for a single TEI (learner/teacher) to have two active enrolments attached to two different organization units.

issues.summary: Update of events under multiple enrolments for same Tracked Entity Instance
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Needed for tracking students across school years which in the SEMIS model uses a new enrolment for each new school year

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

SEMIS users

## ‚ùì Problem Description

With the current model of the SEMIS application, a TEI has a new enrollment with each new year (as they are promoted to a new grade). This necessitates for the completion of previous enrollment and then adding a new enrollment in order to update events for the new year.

However, there are situations where some data for the previous year may need to be updated within the new year or even data for new year to be updated before the close of the previous year (in preparation). For example if performance/ examination results need to be updated and at the same time preparation of entries for the new year needs to be done.

For this to be possible, one would need to at least have both of the enrollments open so events under both can be updated concurrently.
