issues.summary: Allow view access to the patient for viewing own/child's records
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Individuals and community members are responsible for the health care of their relatives, for example a mother and a child. Allow view access implies that users can access the health record of patients they are responsible for, and consult their health data. 

This use case cann be seen as an extension of [https://dhis2.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/ROADMAP/ideas/view/3513029?selectedIssue=ROADMAP-78](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/ROADMAP/ideas/view/3513029?selectedIssue=ROADMAP-78). 

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

Users that are in charge of a patient health care.

## ‚ùì Problem Description

In some cases a a person is reponsible for the health care of one or more other patients. In those cases the caretaker will need to access the record to see the health information. 

## ü§î¬†Assumptions

The patient is already registered in the system and the caretaker has legal responsibility over the patient.

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

Idea reported during the Roadmap process.

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-13488](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-13488) *This is about allowing patient to have mechanism to log in and view their information/medical history, and also can be able to add event to their medical profile.*¬†

*In the psychotherapy program, when consultant add a patient, and giving consultation for pregnant mother or postnal care, mother who have depression. Mother need to update their mental situation, daily activity to the system, giving questions,... when they are at home, Then next time visit consultant, the consultant can see and evaluate the patient.*¬†

*The patient can only navigate on his/her patient profile only, they won't see other patient information. and they also can see/update some information that allow them to see/update, not all the information.*¬†

## (!)¬†Out of Scope

Undefined at the moment.

## (?)¬†Open Questions

|**Question**|**Answer**|**Date Answered**|
|Do users also need to edit the health records, or is it enough to access and read?| |Type // to add a date|

issues.summary: Program rule: Complete current enrollment and enroll the TEI in a different program
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:

Add a program rule action to complete the current enrollment

Add a program rule action to complete the current enrollment AND reenroll the same TEI in the same program

Add a program rule action to complete the current enrollment and enroll the same TEI in a new program

Add a program rule action to compete the current enrollment and enroll a different TEI in a new program

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

Tracker users: enables workflows that better match country guidelines (ex: complete ANC enrollment after birth outcome, and enroll child in the immunization program).

Data quality: reduces the challenge of persistent open enrollments

## ‚ùì Problem Description

Cleans up the persistent incomplete enrollments that could be closed based on specific conditions, enables improved workflow

issues.summary: Program rules: Re-run program rules for existing/legacy data
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Ability to update existing data and rerun the program rules for accuracy

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

System admins: enable program rules to run on imported data without workarounds

Data quality: improve historical data quality by applying updated / improved program rules

Data users: provide a unified dataset with the same rules applied to all values

## ‚ùì Problem Description

Program rules are used to improve data quality, generate actions, and drive data use in particular ways. Currently program rules run only on newly entered data, ignoring existing data or imported data.

## ü§î¬†Assumptions

List any assumptions you have about your users, technical constraints, or business goals.

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-19859](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-19859) 

{quote}*I would like to know how to ensure that a* ***program rule*** *(which I‚Äôve already configured in DHIS2) applies not only to* ***new data entered going forward****, but also to* ***existing or retrospective data*** *that was entered before the rule was created or updated.* 

***Context:***

*I have created a program rule with conditions to show/hide fields or auto-populate values based on certain inputs.*

*It works correctly when entering* ***new events*** *or updating existing ones manually in the* ***Capture App****.*

*However, the rule does* ***not automatically apply to older data*** *that has already been entered unless I open and re-save each record.*{quote}

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-6316](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-6316) 

{quote}*Often, part way through a clients lifecycle in DHIS2 they will have entered a vast amount of data, and they then want to improve their analysis capabilities. In more complex cases this can require additional values to be added to program stages with assign value program rules.*

*However currently there is no way to apply these program rules to data entered before the rule was created (other than manually opening every single event in tracker capture).*
*This means the users cannot have the analysis they want, even though it's possible to create the program indicators or indicators. Or a script must be developed to apply the logic of the program rule to the legacy data for each and every program rule.*

*If there was a feature in data administration to allow program rules to be applied to legacy data this would allow users to enhance their data analysis during the lifetime of the project.*{quote}

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-13577](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-13577) 

{quote}*As a developer, I would like for program rules, if changed, to run for events which were completed before the change in order for the data in all events to be updated with the changes, especially if multiple records have already been entered.*

*When a program rule is changed or created, it will automatically run on events or encounters which have already been created and completed, without a user having to manually incomplete the events.  When creating a new program rule, it should update all existing events regardless of completion status.  If a new event is created which predates an existing event then the programs should update all events.*{quote}

issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

To allow the user to create program rules that consider data across programs

issues.summary: Tracked entity search performance improvements
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
Two main features will be added to improve search prformance:

1. Configurability tracked entity attribute based searches with sensible defaults: Tracked entity attributes needs to specify which search type that is a good default when users are searching using that tracked entity attribute. Which method is default is an indication that the Capture app, Android capture app and other custom clients should use this operator as the preferred operator for search. This default MAY also be enforced, if the default is enforced, the API will reject any searches with other operators for the given tracked entity attribute.
## The default is defined in the Maintenance app, and stored on the tracked entity attribute, and will be interpreted by the clients.
## The LIKE operator is the one most likely to cause slow performing queries(first observed profiling the Rwanda EPI instance but also match expectation). Therefore the maintenance app will pre-select EQUALS or other suiting operators if the user does not make an explicit choice of search operator.
1. (If needed) Ability to configure trigram indexes dynamically, including running scheduled jobs and showing a summary

issues.summary: Data entry by reading RFID tags
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.customfield_10194: Enable collecting data through RFID tags/supports
issues.description: DHIS2 allows data entry through key boards or by scanning a range of different barcodes. Barcodes have the disadvantage that they can only be entered one by one and that a camera has to be pointed at a barcode from the correct distance, at the correct angle and under specific lighting conditions. GS1 DataMatrix codes measure only a few millimetres and are particularly cumbersome to read. This feature proposes reading RFID tags for certain data entry points.

issues.summary: Implement Text speech to fill the data on the table.
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.customfield_10194: Enable collecting data through voice recognition (for aggregate data)..-
issues.description:
In some use cases, users will be faster if they can use speech-to-text to record their data. The use case reporting this request is the real time stock monitoring, where users scan a product and say outloud the number of items on stock. Other use cases might need to be considered if this is implemented. Application might be restricted to integer numbers.

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
**LMIS USE CASE**

**Current behaviour**

The BAO-systems RTS app (developed in 2021) already included a fully functional speech-to-text entry option but this feature was not included in the DHIS2-RTS version. One reason was that the Google (?) speech engine which BAO-systems used is not compatible with DHIS2 development standards. Nevertheless, BAO-systems did demonstrate the feasibility of integrating this feature into a DHIS2 mobile application. The screenshot below indicates the red microphone ready to record the quantity.

!image-20240107-182023.png|width=712,height=413!

Users currently enter data by scanning barcodes and entering data with an onscreen keyboard which is displayed when prompted. While the DHIS2-RTS is far more efficient than paper-based sytems, it is still not ideal as the user has to:

** pick up a mobile device which always requires using both hands (and putting anything else down)

** open the DHIS2-RTS mobile application

** select the "scan" icon (which requires both hands)

** scan a bar code (which requires one hand for a mobile phone or both hands for a tablet computer)

** enter the quantity on the mobile device through the onscreen keyboard (again requiring the use of both hands)

** lay down the mobile device (alternatively hanging it around her/his neck)

** physically pick and count the healthcare goods and place them on a trolley

** pickup up the mobile device again etc.

In principle the mobile device is only needed for scanning a barcode and entering a quantity and it is not practical to manipulate, especially larger tablet computers, just for scanning a small barcode and then typing a few digits.

Typing numbers all day is tedious and prone to errors and far slower than speaking them.

This innovation would allow healthcare facilities in LMICs to leapfrog technological developments and use modern stock management systems found in most commercial stores around the world (including in LMICs).

Speech-recognition was invented by the Bell Labs in 1952 with transcription of simple numbers and is a well established technology and has been widely popularized with Siri (2010), Alexa (2014) and Google Assistant (2016).

"Voice directed warehousing operations" was introduced in the early 1990s and is a well established technology in commercial warehouses. Note that unlike commercial settings, in the context of using DHIS2 for medical stocks, an electronic record of the order is not available and will be managed from a paper record (while a commercial system would also "read" the required items one by one and direct the user which item to pick).

**Desired behaviour**

The overal objective of this feature is allowing the "handsfree" use of the DHIS2-RTS mobile application which requires two components:

** connection of a small handheld or finger mounted barcode reader (see JIRA ticket 

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/ANDROAPP-5097](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/ANDROAPP-5097) +)+ which allows users to use both of their hands for order picking (retrieving healthcare products from the shelf, counting them and placing them on a trolley) rather than blocking at least one hand for manipulating the mobile device for scanning barcodes and requiring both hands for typing quantities

** speech-to-text data entry and text-to-speech synthesis for reading text outload

These two components would allow the user to place a Tablet PC on the trolley (strapping on the wrist etc.) used for picking the healthcare goods, opening the DHIS2-RTS on the mobile device but then entering data without having to use the mobile device at all.

The speech-to-text functionality actually has three separate and distinct features:

** recognition of wake words (voice commands for operating and navigating through the DHIS2-RTS app such as "Scan" and "Enter")

** speech-recognition of numbers for recording the selected quantities

** text-to-speech functionality for "reading back" entered data

**Desired workflow**

The user takes a paper record with an order (filled in on a printed form or an informal list), goes to the medical store and:

** switches on the mobile device

** authenticates in the DHIS2 Capture Android app

** opens the DHIS2-RTS application

** activates the voice recognition mode

** selects the transaction type (if needed as "Distribution" appears by default)

** selects the Organisation Unit (if needed as most users will be assigned to a single OU)

** selects "Deliver to" (name of the ward or service such as operating theatre or surgical ward)

** places the mobile device safely in a cradle on trolley (to prevent falling and damage)

** dones a bluetooth ring barcode scanner which is connected to the mobile device

** dones a microphone which is connected to the mobile device

*For each item to be picked*

** says "Scan": DHIS2-RTS activates the barcode scanner

** scans the barcode: DHIS2-RTS selects the item in the list, opens the field for entering the quantity and "listens" to the user

** says "two thousand" (for example or whatever quantity is required) and "Enter" (to confirm completion of the quantity): DHIS2-RTS converts the speech into text and writes it into the data field and reads back the entry, for example "Paracetamol, 500 mg, tabs, two thousand"

** in case the recorded quantity exceeds the available stock on hand, the speech engine will say "maximum quantity [maximum]" and the user has to reduce the quantity to the available maximum

** etc. until the last item is picked

** selects "Review" button, double-checks the order picking by comparing the selected quantities with the recorded quantities

** if necessary, makes corrections manually

** confirms the order picking

** de-activates the voice recognition mode

In case mistakes are made, the user will have to make corrections manually (as otherwise there would be endless options of different workflows) as the objective is to facilitate the "happy path" assuming mistakes are rare.

**Functional requirements**

** applies only to the "Distribution" transaction (as the "Discard" and "Correction" transaction must be rare and it is not worthwhile to customize details to them as they will be used only rarely)

** button which allows the user to activate or deactivate the voice recognition functionality

** development for the main languages English, Spanish, French, Russian and Arabic

** recognition of "wake words" for "Scan" and "Enter" and effecting the corresponding navigation in the DHIS2-RTS mobile application

** speech-to-text conversion of the spoken quantity

** speech functionality for example for announcing errors (such as when the maximum quantity is exceeded)
{panel}

issues.summary: Data entry: display GPS accuracy
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.customfield_10194: Display GPS coordinates accuracy in coordinates selector.
issues.description:
## Release Notes Description

**New Capture Coordinates process:**  Introducing new features designed to enhance the capture coordinates process. These improvements aim to provide greater accuracy, flexibility, and control over location data capture.

** **Accuracy:** The capture coordinates process now includes a feature that displays the precision of the captured location. This allows users to see how accurate their location data is in real-time. This parameter can also be restricted using the Android Settings WebApp.
** **Search Functionality:** A new search functionality has been added, allowing users to look up specific locations by name or address. Users are also able to navigate through the map and perform area searches to discover other locations within a specified region. 
** **Block Manual Capture:* Using the Android Settings Web App, administrators now have the option to block manual location capture. When this setting is enabled, users can only capture the current location and cannot manually select or search a different one. This ensures that location data remains consistent and accurate.

[+Jira+](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/ANDROAPP-6330) | [+Release card 1+](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/dhis2-android/release+notes+3.1/release+cards/Android-3-1-disabled-manual-capture.png) | [+Release card 2+](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/dhis2-android/release+notes+3.1/release+cards/Android-3-1-map-accuracy.png) | [+Release card 3+](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/dhis2-android/release+notes+3.1/release+cards/Android-3-1-map-search.png) | [+Documentation1+](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/use/android-app/program-features.html#capture*app*programs*common*features*map*accuracy) +|+ [+Documentation 2+](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/use/android-app/settings-configuration.html#capture*app*android*settings*webapp*appearance*program*specific)

## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

The Android App needs to display the current accuracy in the coordinates selector when capturing current location. This provides a helpful prompt to recapture if the accuracy is low. Without this visual indicator, users capture very inaccurate coordinates without realizing. 

This need applies to any coordinate capture using the mobile app - Enrollment, Event and data element coordinates.

This will provide much-needed accuracy to community-level data capturing. which will ensure improved quality of geo coordinates especially at the household level. overall, good accuracy improves quality of data entry at the community level.

## :people*holding_hands: Users description

Helpful in urban and rural environments across multiple users and teams (EPI, bed nets, deliveries, entomology sentinel sites) and associated varied devices. Translates to cleaner map visuals for all MOH levels, partners, funders.

## ‚ùì Problem Description

When users are collecting coordinates with their mobile phone, the accuracy of the actual coordinates is not displayed in the user interface. However, GPS coordinates can be extremely inaccurate, but we know that accuracy improves with time or if the user captures coordinate 2-3 times. 

The GPS feature currently is not trustworthy, and users need to confirm their GPS location as sometimes the signal is not very strong, resulting in inaccurate data capture. 

Without displaying accuracy information, it is very easy to just tap it and forget about whether the reading is accurate or not. Users are constantly capturing inaccurate GPS coordinates, simply because they are not getting visual feedback to re-capture. Displaying the accuracy will allow implementers to train users on leveraging this information to try capturing a few more times to let the accuracy increase .

In door to door data collection deliveries and sometimes the coordinates don't come as accurate as users don't have idea of the accuracy then collecting the coordinates.

issues.customfield_10194: Support optional, opt-in, anonymous collection of basic quantiative system information to help improve future DHIS2 releases and identify potential pain points or issues earlier in the development process.
issues.description:
Support optional, opt-in, anonymous collection of basic quantiative system information to help improve future DHIS2 releases and identify potential pain points or issues earlier in the development process.

Data to be collected might include:

** DHIS2 version
** Versions of installed apps
** Whether an instance is production, staging, or other
** Which data models are in use (aggregate, event, tracker)
** Number of users
** Number and topology of Org Units
** Information from ‚ÄúAbout DHIS2‚Äù page

issues.summary: Solution for restricting access to sensitive tracker data (Non-analyzable attributes)
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.customfield_10194: Ability to mark some attributes and data elements as non-analysable, in order to protect personally identifiable and otherwise sensitive information
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Ensure that sensitive or personally identifiable information captured in tracked entity attributes can be excluded from analytics, API calls and exports.

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

Tracked entity attributes often must contain sensitive or personally identifiable information, such as birthday, HIV status, home address, which are used for proper identification of the individual and programmatic purposes. In most cases, this information is not necessary to be included in analytics, and should not be exposed or exported from the system without the deliberate design choice to do so.

|Role/domain - Functionality - Motivation|
|As a system administrator, I want to be able to make sure that PII will not be available through the analytics apps / exportable / exposed through the API|
|I still want to be able to exchange PII with other patient-based systems|
|As a user administrator trying to limit the access to personally identifiable data, want to prevent non-clinical users from having access to attributes that are central for identification, so that as few people as possible have access to identifiable information.|
|As a system administrator, I want the analytics process to consume as few resources as possible, so that the overall system performance is penalized as little as possible.|
|I want to be able to see aggregations of the data (indicators) but not individual level data|

## ‚ùì Problem Description

PII appearing in linelists or included in data exports

## ü§î¬†Assumptions

** System configurers already have options on tracked entity attributes that allow them to be excluded from search, or not shown in lists. Adding an additional choice to exclude the attribute to analytics would be intuitive and empower system designers to make better security choices.
** There has already been implemented [+a flag/Boolean option called ‚ÄòskipAnalytics‚Äô in the program stage data element model+](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-11720). A technical review should be done to see if this solution is sufficient enough for attributes as well.¬†

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

[Non-analyzable attributes and data elements - Requirements Document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PG*1dbKMFnZpb*Dsl1vyMIyXf6gAtYEGJ51skAkpapQ/edit#heading=h.wdit9bo4ao1b)

## (!)¬†Out of Scope

List the features discussed which are out of scope or might be revisited in a later release.

## (?)¬†Open Questions

|**Question**|**Answer**|**Date Answered**|
|e.g., How might we make users more aware of this feature?|e.g., We'll announce the feature with a blog post and a presentation|Type // to add a date|

issues.description: THIS ISSUE WILL BE MERGED WITH [https://dhis2.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/ROADMAP/ideas/view/3513029?selectedIssue=ROADMAP-78](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/ROADMAP/ideas/view/3513029?selectedIssue=ROADMAP-78)

issues.summary: Self reporting/monitoring for Tracked Entities
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Individuals and community members are active participants in their own health and the health of their communities.Empowering individuals to report on their own health data through mobile solutions enables more *robust data collection* and facilitates *task shifting* among the health workforce. Health workers‚Äô time traditionally spent on data collection & reporting can be reallocated to improve data analysis and patient-centered care. Finally, self-reporting and feedback loops can expand the reach of health interventions and data systems to individuals who face barriers accessing health facilities.¬†

Self monitoring implies that patients can access their own health record and consult and update their own health data. In some cases patinents will only need to see their data wihtout need to edit. 

This use case is extended here> [https://dhis2.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/ROADMAP/ideas/view/4066207?selectedIssue=ROADMAP-136](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/ROADMAP/ideas/view/4066207?selectedIssue=ROADMAP-136) 

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

Patients that are already registered in a health program.

## ‚ùì Problem Description

In some cases / health programs patients are in really remote areas and having health staff monitoring them is not feasible, not even community health staff. Some programs requiere dayli upadtes and patients are requested to keep track of themselves and then, weekly or bi-weekley, when visited by a health worker they report all that information that is in many cases forgotten or not well recorded. Visits of this nature also take  alot of time.

In other cases, for example an epidemic, even if patinets are reachable, is simply not manageable to monitor them on daily basis, or not recommended for infectious risks. 

## ü§î¬†Assumptions

The patient is already regitsered in the system.

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

This use case was already studied during covid. The source are many inputs from the community. 

Reference douments from that study can be found here: 

** [Self reporting concept note](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1uGMxHg*02UaJvpnPldRJ2uBBlK2UsyibPiwjXC*JGQg/edit#heading=h.midsb1pv3ak1)
** [Self reporting user stories](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1cB0YP*tS0ZL4wdaJQSN1wuDo*SLj6R9tO-LnaehBXiQ/edit#gid=0)

## (!)¬†Out of Scope

Self reporting could be addressed at different levels (see below). This Idea is refering to number 5. Self monitoring. The other use casesa re out of scope.

1. Self assessment: mobile tools that enable an individual to make a self-assessment about whether he/she has COVID-10 symptoms
1. Self reporting of aggregate/non-identifiable data: these user stories included mass surveys for individuals to report in whether or not they have COVID-19-like symptoms; only aggregate data are captured primarily for public health analytics purposes
1. Self-identification: an individual is ‚Äúunknown‚Äù to the health care system and make themself known through software (e.g. Tanzania hotline: individual calls hotline and phone number is pushed to DHIS2 event program through USSD solution for follow up
1. Self-registration: an individual records their own details to ease the burden of the health workers on registration (e.g. a patient ‚Äòself enrolls‚Äô into a suspected COVID-19 case program
1. Self-monitoring: an individual has had contact with the health system to be enrolled into some sort of longitudinal monitoring program, but they submit data themselves during the course of follow up period (e.g. an individual is registered into DHIS2 program by a CHW as a contact of a confirmed case and submit updates everyday for 14 days about whether or not they have developed symptoms)

## (?)¬†Open Questions

|**Question**|**Answer**|**Date Answered**|
|How will patinets identify/authenticate themselves?| | |

issues.summary: Program Indicator Disaggregations
issues.creator: David Kennedy
issues.customfield_10194: This feature enables the possibility of creating dissagregations for Program Indicators that match with existing category options, and combinations.
issues.description:
## Release notes description

This feature enables the possibility of creating disaggregations for Program Indicators that match with existing category options, and combinations. Such disaggregation will facilitate analysing Program Indicators by those disaggregation with the analytics apps as well as aggregating the values and importing within an aggregated data model though the exchange app.

[Feature card](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/releases/screenshots/42/42-program-disaggregation.png) | 

## 

üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Support bucketed program indicator outputs, mapping to category option combinations so that a single Program indicator can be converted to multiple aggregate data element values without having to create a program indicator for each permutation.

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

Crosses a large range of users that use program indicators  This is an important LMIS issue. 

## ‚ùì Problem Description

Reduce redundancy in PIs usage as currently you have to re-create multiple PIs to meet the required disaggregations

it is getting difficult to maintain thousands of program indicators with one change affecting all copies of the same indicator with different age and gender disaggregations

This could help support tracker to aggregate integration without creating massive amounts of metadata.

This is an important LMIS issue. The DHIS2-RTS Tracker Program allows recording "Distribution" for 17 different "Deliver to" (surgical ward, operating theatre etc.), total "Deliver" as well as "Receipt", "Discard" and "Correction" for, say 300 different health care products (TEIs). In order to provide daily and monthly aggregates we therefore need 22 x 300 = 6,600 Program Indicators (and 6,600 Predictors for the "daily" and an additional 6,600 Predictors for the "monthly" report in an "aggregate" Data entry form).

## ü§î¬†Assumptions

Needs to be considered along with other tracker to aggregate issues and tracker analytics issues

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

What were the sources of input for this requirement

## (!)¬†Out of Scope

List the features discussed which are out of scope or might be revisited in a later release.

|**Question**|**Answer**|**Date Answered**|
|e.g., How might we make users more aware of this feature?|e.g., We'll announce the feature with a blog post and a presentation|Type // to add a date|

issues.description:
Confluence: [https://dhis2.atlassian.net/wiki/x/NIBKJ](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/wiki/x/NIBKJ) 

## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

Admin users are able to send a request to the DHIS2 Android app to synchronize its local data. The syncronization triggered in the local device does not require any action from the app user. Admin users can send a sync request to a specific user (Maybe to a specific org. unit).   

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

Admin users of DHIS2, those in charge of managing the data and/or the mobile implementation. 

## ‚ùì Problem Description

Syncrhonizing data from the field is one the most critical aspects of the Android App. In some cases users do not sync when required (submission timelines) or have data stored in their devices and stop working in the organization, this can create situations of data loss and data privacy incidents. In other cases users have issues syncing and the admin users admins needs to force a syncronization in a particular moment to replicate an error and be able to troubleshoot.

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

This issue comes from collecting input during field visits and academies.

In some cases, not all information is available within DHIS2 itself.  Some examples include looking up demographic information from an external client registry / looking up terminologies from a terminology service / etc.

This request can already be solved on web only with tracker data entry plugins (v41) and the routes API (v40).  However, the request remains to solve this more generically through configuration (define an API lookup including query parameters and response mappings.

PAHO, WHODrug, ICD-11, KS

The data entry forms are sometimes not capable of giving the user all the information required. Images or pictures can add context and information to help understand the question and/or the answers. With this feature end users will be able to see images next to their data entry fields. The images provide illustrative information to the questions being made and/or guidance for the possible answers. To do so the system should be able to link images to the different metadata objects being either questions or options for answers and display them in a size and position that facilitates understanding its meaning and relation with the data point.

issues.summary: Custom Periods (Academic periods)
issues.creator: Philip Larsen Donnelly
issues.customfield_10194: There are some EMIS related requirements around how to define a school year that overlap with some general requirements for creating and managing custom periods.
issues.description:
## üéØ¬†High Level use case 

There are some EMIS related requirements around how to define a school year divided into terms that overlap with some general requirements for creating and managing custom periods. Terms are a date range that is uniquely defined every year and are unique to countries, hence global, generic terms do not exist. Terms include school holidays and breaks that should not be included as expected days of reporting. 

This could be generically applied to cohort, unique financial years, EPI weeks, or campaign periods analysis where data ranges are used to define cohorts and analytics should be applied/isolated to those date ranges. 

## :people*holding*hands: Users description

Users are analytics and data entry users that need to capture or visualize data by term. 

## ‚ùì Problem Description

The issues is that DHIS2 does not allow for configurable period ranges to be used for data entry or analytics. All period ranges are defined from the standard calendar and are globally set. 

## ü§î¬†Assumptions

** Terms/custom periods will cover every day in the year meaning that there are no days not in a term. 
** Analytics tables can be expanded to accommodate for custom periods. 

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Sources

EMIS, Campaign planning, cohort analysis

## (!)¬†Out of Scope

List the features discussed which are out of scope or might be revisited in a later release.

## (?)¬†Open Questions

|**Question**|**Answer**|**Date Answered**|
|Is this for data entry and analytics or is it just for analytics?| |Type // to add a date|
|Are custom periods organized in some way?| | |
|Are custom period date ranges mutually exclusive?| | |
|Can other periods be used or should be used in concert with custom periods?| | |

issues.summary: Metadata deduplication and merging
issues.creator: Philip Larsen Donnelly
issues.customfield_10194: Merging of metadata is being gradually supported within DHIS2 core funcitonalities facilitating metadata cleanup operations.
issues.description:
## Release notes description

Merging of metadata is being gradually supported within DHIS2 core functionalities facilitating metadata cleanup operations. Backend supports merging the following metadata objects through the web API: Organisation Units, Data Elements, Indicators, Indicator Types, Category options, Category option combinations (limited to one use case, when the Category option combinations are the same). Frontend support through the user interface is gradually implemented as well. So far the new Maintenance app supports merging options for Category options, Indicators and Indicator types. In these cases the user is able to select the ‚Äúsource‚Äù object to merge and the ‚Äútarget‚Äù object to merge references to.

[Documentation](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/develop/using-the-api/dhis-core-version-master/metadata.html#webapi*indicator*merge) | [Feature card](https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/content.dhis2.org/releases/screenshots/42/42-configure-metadata-deduplication.png) | Screenshot 1 | 2 | 3

Metadata loaded as a group, such as from a toolkit, is hard to track as a group after being imported, it would be useful to have more management options of groups of metadata.

System admins  across all domains

issues.customfield_10194: Introducing a new simple scheduler based on the current database state, running asynchronously to execute task configurations. This eliminates issues with the previous "black box" approach, ensuring the job triggers as specified in the configuration.
issues.description: The scheduler app currently renders part of its UI based on the backend types for certain fields, this has not scaled well so there is now a requirement to move the scheduler to a more declarative architecture.

issues.creator: Philip Larsen Donnelly
issues.customfield_10194: We have created our own new cross platform expression parser. Built on Koltin this expression parser uses a different approach to parsing which provides a lot of performance benefits for the type of expressions used in DHIS2.
issues.description:
Creating our own expression parser, leaving behind Antlr. This expression parser uses a different approach to parsing which provides a lot of performance benefits for the type of expressions used in DHIS2.

¬†

This item is about creating an initial version of this expression parser using Kotlin, allowing us to use it across all platforms (Android, Server and Web). Additionally it also includes adding support for the expressions we use today, primarily Rule Engine for this item.

This is to support JPA annotation mapping for object model in DHIS2. Below are steps need to be done:** Add {{javax.persistence}}.{{EntityManagerFactory}} bean to {{HibernateConfig}} so all DAO classes can use {{EntityManager}} instead of hibernate {{SessionFactory}}** Keep {{SessionFactory}}bean to avoid breaking changes for current DAO classes. We can slowly migrate to {{EntityManager}}** Support both hibernate {{**.hbm.xml}} mapping files and JPA annotation mapping. Will slowly migrate all hbm files to annotation.

issues.summary: Remove (most) of Apache Struts framework
issues.creator: Philip Larsen Donnelly
issues.customfield_10194: Removing the dependency on the Apache Struts framework will simplify the code structure, reduced framework-specific dependencies and will make the code more flexible, extensible and allow for easier adoption of modern frameworks.
issues.description: Remove the dependency on Struts. Struts has not been properly maintained, and poses potential issues. There has been on-going work with removing Struts for a long time, including replacing all Struts-apps with React-apps. Removing the dependency of Struts will free up any limitations related to Struts and lessen the burden of any Struts-related maintenance.

issues.summary: Program indicator groups in Analytics

issues.description:
Enable filtering/searching by program indicator groups in analytics.

** [https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-10478](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-10478) Program indicator groups should be a selection dropdown in the data dimension selector the same as data element or indicator groups.¬†
In the drop down list that lists programs, can be extended to have a list of "programName - ALL" for all program indicators in a program and "programName - [GRP]GroupName" for program indicators in a group.
Users then do not have to search through all program indicators assigned to a program. See also linked issues for similar requests.
** [https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-15188](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-15188) The analytics endpoint allows the following data dimension items. It would be helpful to also be able to provide a PI group. It currently allows DE groups, and Indicator groups, but not PI groups.
Data element, indicator, data set reporting rate metrics, data element operand, program indicator, program attribute identifiers, keyword DE*GROUP-<group-id>, IN*GROUP-<group-id>, use <dataelement-id>.<optioncombo-id> for data element operands, <program-id>.<dataelement-id> for program data elements, <program-id>.<attribute-id> for program attributes, <validationrule-id> for validation results.
We would like to use this when testing the tracker to aggregate integration process.

issues.summary: Explore VR travel features
issues.creator: Austin McGee
issues.customfield_10194: This idea is about this

issues.summary: Improve waiting list experience
issues.creator: Austin McGee
issues.customfield_10194: This idea is about X
issues.description:
## üí° Hypothesis

When customers are signing up for the waiting list for our most famous travel plans, they do not get enough information about waiting time or what‚Äôs next for them.

**We believe that this lack of information** prevents them to sign up for more waiting lists and affects their overall satisfaction regarding their experience on the platform.

**This will benefit users by** providing them with more advantages, the more they are using the platform and will encourage new users to use the platform even more.

## üóíÔ∏è Solution Definition

When a user subscribes to a waiting list they receive information about:

** Their real-time position on the waiting list,
** A countdown up to the start of the event,
** A checklist on what to prepare if a spot becomes free.

## :test_tube: **Validation*

This hypothesis will be validated if we notice an increase in waiting list subscriptions, globally and per customer.

issues.description:
### **Prioritize using fields**

Fields represent granular criteria or facets of an idea that can help you compare and prioritize ideas such as goals, effort level, business impact, etc. The project contains a set of predefined fields, but you can create as many new fields as you need.

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Create a new field by clicking ‚ÄúFields‚Äù and ‚ÄúCreate a new field.‚Äù
{panel}

**Work with views**

Views are different ways to visualize your ideas and help you prioritize them. You can find them on the left panel and customize them according to your need. We‚Äôve created a few views to get you started:

**Prioritize**

** Impact assessment: List view sorted by the ‚Äúimpact score‚Äù field,
** Impact vs. Effort: Get a Matrix view to identify your best bets.

**Communicate**

** Product Roadmap: Use this view to align which ideas are being worked on at the moment, with visibility on the next iteration,
** Product Timeline: Share this view with stakeholders and customer-facing teams to communicate your plans.

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Create new views by clicking ‚Äú + Create a view‚Äù in the side panel.
{panel}

issues.summary: 1 - Gather ideas and insights in Jira Product Discovery
issues.creator: Austin McGee

issues.summary: Image or media as description (or other field) on metadata
issues.creator: Chase Freeman
issues.description:
Apologies if this is a duplicate or has been discussed previously, I searched but couldn‚Äôt find anything.

User Story

As a data administrator in DHIS2, I want the ability to attach images or media files as visual references to specific metadata elements (e.g., data elements, indicators, or datasets), So that I can provide clear and illustrative guidance to data collectors regarding the information they should gather for each metadata element.

Acceptance Criteria:

1. When creating or editing a metadata element (e.g., a data element or indicator), I should have the option to upload and link images or media files as visual references.
1. Each attached image or media file should be associated with a specific metadata element, allowing it to serve as a visual guide or example for data collectors.
1. Data collectors should be able to access these visual references when entering data for the corresponding metadata element, providing them with visual context and clarity about the data to be collected.
1. The system should support common image and media formats (e.g., JPEG, PNG, MP4) for attaching visual references.
1. There should be clear documentation and guidance on how to upload and manage visual references for metadata elements.

1. If the selected enrollment date does not match today's date, show a warning or error message below the enrollment date.
1. add functionality that will enable assigning/changing EVENT DATE in current event with a program rule/program rule action.

Discussed [https://community.dhis2.org/t/disable-direct-writing-for-data-element-type-is-coordination/54554/2](https://community.dhis2.org/t/disable-direct-writing-for-data-element-type-is-coordination/54554/2)  for more context

issues.summary: Improve DHIS2 Calculation of completeness rate to Exclude Weekends and Holidays
issues.creator: Jerry AZIAWA
issues.description:
Currently, DHIS2 calculates completion rates taking into account all days, including weekends and public holidays. However, it has been identified that this approach can lead to inaccurate figures in EMIS, as weekends and public holidays should ideally be excluded from the calculation. Especially when you are collecting daily attendance data. As a consequence completeness rate can never be 100% eventhough data has been collected all the school days. Please find attached a screenshot of completeness rate for daily attendance

**Benefits:**

1. Improved accuracy of completion rate calculations, providing more meaningful insights into attendance patterns.
1. Better alignment of completion rate calculations with actual attendance data.
1. Enhanced usability for organizations that require precise attendance analytics.

issues.summary: Extending Indicator Year-to-date functionality to include Fiscal Year to Date

issues.description:
The Indicator Year-to-date functionality is valuable, but we work on a fiscal year starting October, and would be able to more easily utilize it if there were a fiscalYearOctToDate option. Also relevant would be [periodInFYOct] and   [FYOctPeriodCount].

[~accountid:61bc76e4acc926006a14c207] , we talked about this in the Predictors session.

issues.summary: Extending [periodInYear] to Program Indicators and Program Rules and adding [Period in Fiscal Year Oct]
issues.creator: Kayla Stankevitz
issues.description:
Hello,

The new indicator Year-to-date functionality is very interesting, and we could use the [periodInYear] item available for Program related calculations as well.

Use case: Our country teams previously captured follow-up with clients in Excel, with one column for each month. We‚Äôve structured a DHIS2 tracker program stage in a similar way, to make it easier for users. There is one BOOLEAN DE for each month, and the peer navigator can check the box for the month if they verified everything with the client in the given month. This makes it so that they only have to create one event each fiscal year, and they can really easily query which clients haven‚Äôt been followed up in the given month. However, its more difficult for indicator calculations, because we need a way of saying ‚ÄúIf the period is March, check if March==Yes; else if the period is April, check if April==Yes‚Ä¶.‚Äù

If we could have a periodInYear item, it could make this much simpler.

Ideally, we would also like a period in fiscal year item, as we work with an October FY. But period in Year could work as well.

There is a similar use case for Program Rules.. in this case we could restrict data entry in months that are in the future.

issues.summary: Option set improvements: Create options on the fly, store multiple values
issues.creator: Yury Rogachev
issues.description:
It will be helpful for tracker users to be able to add values to a single data element which will be treated as separate values and not as 1 string during analysis.

Example:

I have one data element: **Your hobbies** in a tracker program stage.
The user is prompted to enter 1 value or several values separated by a special symbol, eg. **comma**

The user then enters:

||**Your hobbies**|**[ LEGO ]** , **[ BOXING ]**, **[ TIME-TRAVELLING ]**|

Each of these values is stored as a separate value and can be extracted and analysed separately.

Similarly: 

||**Countries visited:**|**[ NORWAY ]** , **[ SPAIN ]**, **[ CAR ]**|

This feature could be an expansion of **Multiple Selections** of options in an **Option Set**.

Furthermore, this feature could be expanded by
1) creation of options on the fly (if permitted)
add **option** to an **existing option set** within data entry dashboard.

User would like to have an option to ADD ANOTHER OPTION to an option set when selecting a value. This should allow them to actually add a metadata object (option) to a corresponding option set and make it available to other users on the fly.

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-3674](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-3674) 

{quote}The scenario where you have a data element with an option set but where you are NOT blocked from entering free text is very useful in many contexts. At the moment, this is typically handled by adding multiple additional data element or attributes, where one of them is called e.g. "Other" and with a free text "Specify" attribute/element to hold the free text. While the latter method is OK where you have a multi-choice list, it is a pain where you have a single attribute or data element with an option set.

Note: in e.g. MS Access, this would be similar to the "Limit to list y/n" attribute for data fields - you can specify if only optionsetvalues are allowed or else if not then you can select from a drop-down OR enter free text).
{quote}

issues.summary: Line Listing multiple, cascading sorting
issues.creator: George McGuire
issues.description:
**Current behaviour**

The Line Listing application allows sorting ascending or descending by any attribute simply by clicking on the small blue triangle icon (pointing up or down).

The Line Listing sorted by one attribute is instantly superseded (replaced) by any sorting of any other attribute. That means, tables can only be sorted by a single attribute at a time.

**Use case**

The Line Listing will be the primary analytics application used by storekeepers for the DHIS2-RTS (Real-Time Stock management application) which is currently under development. Typically, storekeepers would like to apply multiple, cascading filters for routine analysis:

1. filter level: transaction date

1. filter level: "Deliver to" destination (ward or service)

1. filter level: item description

or

1. filter level: "Deliver to" destination (ward or service)

1. filter level: item description

1. filter level: transaction date

etc.

One alternative could also be that, by default, any Line Listing is sorted in ascending order of all attributes from the left (1. filter level) to the right (last filter level) whenever a Line Listing report is opened.

**Desired behaviour**

The required workflow is:

** User opens the Line Listing application

** User selects the sort icon (small triangle) for the first attribute: the table is sorted by that column

** User selects the sort icon (small triangle) for the second attribute: the sorting of the first attribute is maintained and within identical rows (of the first attribute) the second attribute is sorted in ascending order

** User selects the sort icon (small triangle) for the third attribute: the sorting of the first and second attribute are maintained and within identical rows (of the first and second attribute) the third attribute is sorted in ascending order

- User has the option to remove the filter from any of the attributes: any filters set for any other attributes are maintained in the same filter level order as initially configured

This feature is commonly available in spreadsheet applications. As an example, user interface in Open Office:

!image-20230119-173929.png|width=686,height=687!

issues.summary: Drop-down filters for Line Listing in Capture (Web and Android)
issues.creator: George McGuire
issues.description:
**Background**

The Line Listing will be the primary analytics tool for the DHIS2-RTS (Real-Time Stock management) which is currently under development. Storekeepers will record dozens or hundreds of transactions for about 100 to 300 different TEIs (items, health care products). Storekeepers will often want to view a transaction history of a specific health care product (TEI) and frequently switch from one to another TEI.

**Current behaviour**

The Line Listing app allows sorting columns (ascending and descending) simply by clicking on the up/down arrows in the header. So instead of filtering for a TEI, the user could sort the attribute and then scroll down the list until finding the TEI of interest. However, given the large number of transactions every day, users will have to scroll a lot which is not convenient on a (small) mobile device.

Users can also filter for any specific TEI in any of the attributes but this requires several clicks for setting as well as for every change:

** Click on dimension

** "Add a condition"

** Select "exactly" as condition

** Type the TEI attribute name: this step is particularly time consuming and inconvenient, particularly on a mobile device

** Update

**Desired behaviour**

This feature is primarily needed on mobile devices (once the Line Listing is available in the off-line in-app Local Analytics)

Ideally, the selection should be possible with a single (or small number) of clicks on a mobile device:

** User opens the Line Listing dashboard

- User identifies the dimension (attribute) "Item description"

1. click: User clicks on the header: a drop-menu appears at the top of the screen

1. click: User selects the required TEI: the drop-down menu closes and the filter is applied

This enhancement would allow to select and filter for any item with only two clicks (one for selecting the header and a second for selecting the TEI).

issues.summary: Data entry by reading RFID tags
issues.creator: George McGuire
issues.description:
**Background**

Gavi and UNICEF have made furnishing of secondary vaccine packaging with GS1 DataMatrix codes mandatory for all vaccine manufacturers from the beginning of 2022. While there are no (known) plans to replace (or complement) GS1 DataMatrix codes by (with) RFID tags, UNICEF has been exploring the use of RFID tags at least since 2008:

[https://magazine.jhsph.edu/2009/fall/news*briefs/a*jewel*for*disease*tracking/](https://magazine.jhsph.edu/2009/fall/news*briefs/a*jewel*for*disease*tracking/) 

And, the potential benefits of unit pack level RFID tags are enormous, almost too good to be true:

** In principle a RFID multi-reader would allow a storekeeper to walk through a store or warehouse with a mobile device and carry out a complete physical stock count without having to count or manipulate a single individual unit packs.

** A RFID multi-reader installed at the door of a pharmacy would allow a storekeeper to simply pass through a basket with several unit packs of health care products and DHIS2 automatically recording the stock transaction as well as the (re-)calculating the stock on hand and prompting automated replenishment orders.

** The capability for reading RFID tags has other potentials such as marking baskets with the name of the ward/service receiving a consignment and including this data in the DHIS2 stock transaction record

** Smart refrigerators could keep track of their contents as well as all transactions without any human record, simply by placing vaccines in and removing them from the refrigerator and Gavi/UNICEF could locate any (counterfeit) serialized unit pack simply by querying a database

Therefore, although use of the technology depends on manufacturers furnishing unit packs with RFID tags, the request is intended to be prepared for rapidly approaching technologies and be able to offer Gavi/UNICEF a tool as soon as they implement this technology.

In 2020, 90% of mobile phones shipped by manufacturers were NFC-enabled (near field communication) and this technology was implemented in only a decade.

Considering that the actual NFC (near field communication) capability and reading of data is available natively on nearly all new mobile phones, the DHIS2 development is limited to "importing" this data for further processing.

**Current behaviour**

DHIS2 allows data entry through key boards or by scanning a range of different barcodes. Barcodes have the disadvantage that they can only be entered one by one and that a camera has to be pointed at a barcode from the correct distance, at the correct angle and under specific lighting conditions. GS1 DataMatrix codes measure only a few millimetres and are particularly cumbersome to read.

**Use case**

A storekeeper picking several serialized products (where each unit pack is identified by the manufacturer with its own and unique ID):

** scans the unit packs one by one by passing the RFID tag over the mobile device-device, or

** places all unit packs in a bin and passes the mobile device over the bin (or the bin over the mobile device)

** DHIS2 reads out the data of each RFID tag and stores it on the mobile device in memory

** DHIS2 processes the data further (in the same way as if it had been entered by a keyboard, barcode reader or from a Bluetooth device)

RFID tags have the following advantages:

** Readout by passing them over a mobile device is easier and faster than using a barcode scanner and does not depend on lighting conditions

** Using special RFID tag multi-readers, many RFID tags can be read out simultaneously by passing a mobile device near them rather than having to handle each unit pack separately. This greatly facilitates and speeds up data processing.

issues.summary: Block Enrollment after complete
issues.creator: Nguyen Tran Do Xuan Thuy
issues.description:
The case is we use TEI as an assessment, each assessment has only 1 enrollment and multiple auto generated events based on enrollment date. After each event, we set as block event after complete, so user cannot update the event date. After finish all sub assessment for all program stage, the assessment is completed. User should not be able to update or delete this assessment. It should be block and keep like that forever. 

However, currently, after complete the enrollment or complete a program, user still can open that completed enrollment and update the enrollment date while it is in completing status. We really need the block enrollment date after complete program

issues.summary: Clone/Duplicate event in the Capture app
issues.creator: Fheb
issues.description:
Hello,

Would it be possible to add a ‚ÄúClone Event‚Äù option in the Capture app?

We have an event program for training data. Multiple events may have the same details (e.g. name of activity, date of activity). It would be nice to be able to clone previous events and simply modify items that vary. 

Thank you

********************

[~accountid:61bc76e42960d20069890e22]'s feature request in [https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-15301](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-15301) 

The idea for duplicating an event for Event and Tracker type programs is quite simple.

The end user fills in the data entry form (EVENT) and has an option to click ‚ÄúDUPLICATE‚Äù in order to create a copy of this event.

The event should be duplicated with all selected values and the event date field should be active to give the user a chance to adjust the event date.

Examples of use cases are explained below:

1. A patient is put on treatment and has to receive specific medication regularly.

The events of medication distribution should be recorded. They are used to calculate and validate the stock. A list of medications can be quite long but will likely not change from each distribution event.
Creating a ‚ÄúDUPLICATE EVENT‚Äù button will save the enduser a lot of time and will make the work more efficient.

1. A patient needs to be monitored every month. Depending on the diagnosis, specific tests and checks will be performed repeatedly during the process. Giving the user an option to duplicate event and possibly editing certain fields rather than filling in every event manually will improve the efficiency of data entry.

1. Filling up the events in the EVENT program (surveys, visit reports, etc) will improve the efficiency of manual data entry with ‚ÄúDUPLICATE EVENT‚Äù button.

******

Use case from [~accountid:557058:54184d0f-0ee3-4f2b-9f36-db23c9a97a55] 

This is required mostly in a cases where the user needs to replicate an event with a small change only (ex: in NCD patients the doctor requests 3 Medical prescriptions with the same medications but different dates). Currently they need to compare previous events or stages to fill in the same dataelements in the new event (also note that the compare feature was removed in the new capture app which makes it more difficult also.

issues.summary: Ability to select color to be assigned to null values in pivot table legend

issues.summary: Selective triggering of program rule action types in Tracker importer endpoint
issues.creator: Blake Hansen
issues.description:
Hello!

For the new tracker import endpoint where it is possible to trigger the program rules on the program (which is very cool, by the way) it would be super helpful to be able to selectively choose which rules to trigger based upon the action.

This would mean including a parameter in the post request like "triggerAction= " (though obviously call it whatever makes sense) and then be able to array all rule actions required to trigger (i.e. those listed in the [docs](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/use/user-guides/dhis-core-version-237/configuring-the-system/programs.html#create*program*rule)).¬†

So for example, triggerAction=assignValue,showError - would trigger only the assign value and trigger error rules at import.

What is the use-case?¬†

We have programs which have plenty of skip logic for hide fields - accounting for about 90% of the PRs. The other 10% are show warning, show error, assign value, or mandatory field. We are attempting to import 1000s of events for these programs at once, and the data was completed in such a way that we know the front-end relevant hide/show logic has been respected. When importing currently on a very large server, and parsing events in chunks, the CPU usage spikes (or crashes); whereas turning off the PRs on these programs solves the issue - but is not a reasonable fix. It also appears the tracker import is attempting to trigger all the hide fields logics to test they're being respected; but as noted, this is largely irrelevant. By being able to selectively trigger rule actions it will help reduce server burden and speed up the process of import - which will be a routine (i.e. monthly in >20 countries) process.

issues.summary: Add current_date, period,substring to Indicator functions
issues.creator: Alex
issues.description:
Add current*date,period and substring to Indicator functions.

With the introduction of the periodOffset, there are scenarios where numerator data needs to be summed for a given period and as well as the denominator.

The period should be relative to the offset period e.g if current period is 202104, for #\{DE}.periodOffset(-5) the period should be 202012.

Scenario:

DD indicator data this year ( current report period) = (Month 1 de1 + Month 2 de1+ Month 3 de1 + Month 4 de1 + Month 5 de1 + ......+ Month 12 de1)/(Month 1 de2 + Month 2 de2+ Month 3 de2+ Month 4 de2 + Month 5 de2 +......++¬†Month 12 de2)

Since the data must always fall in a calender year or Oct financial period, the above can be achieved by writing something like this:

DD indicator data this year ( current report period) = (

if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 1 de1,0) + if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 2 de1,0)+ if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 3 de1,0) + if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 4 de1,0) + if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 5 de1,0) + ......+ if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 12 de1,0))/(

if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 1 de2,0) + if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 2 de2,0)+ if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 3 de2,0)+ if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 4 de2,0) + if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current*date,0,4)),Month 5 de2,0)¬†+......++¬†if(substring(period,0,4)== substring(current_date,0,4)),Month 12 de2,0))

issues.summary: dataStatistics aggregation by username
issues.creator: Brian O'Donnell
issues.description:
Views of analytic objects or dashboards are saved to [the datastatistics table.](https://docs.dhis2.org/en/develop/using-the-api/dhis-core-version-master/analytics.html#webapi*usage*analytics)

Those views can be aggregated by favorite or favorite type (chart, dashboard, etc) over time with the *dataStatistics* API endpoint.

This datastatisticsevent table includes the username which triggered the dataStatistics event. However, you cannot aggregate or filter by the username when requesting data from the datastatistics endpoint (example from Play).

!image-2021-07-23-13-37-59-412.png!

Since the username column is recorded in the backend, but is not accessible through the API, this seems to be a deliberate design decision to prevent misuse of user access data. However it prevents more granular analysis of data views by the current user, or segmenting analytics views by user role, user group, org unit, etc.

In my use case, I would like to be able to see:
 ** unique users interacting with each favorite every month
 ** my user's dashboard views per month, compared to views from all users assigned to that dashboard
 * dashboard views from users within my user group(s) or org unit area

Enabling a filter for *username* within the dataStatistics endpoint would enable this analysis.

issues.summary: Program rules: Create a program stage when creating a relationship

Participant training register.

Two programs are set up, Participant profile (Tracker) and Training details (Event program).

Participant profile has a repeat stage to capture post-test and pre-test scores.

There is a bidirectional relationship between the two programs, to know all training sessions a participant attended and also to know how many participants are in each training session.

¬†

Once a participant is added to the training session using the relationship, there is no way of capturing additional information for that participant for that training session, like scores in the relationship.¬† One has to go back to the participant profile and create an event for the attendance stage and capture the scores and the course they attended.

¬†

Possibility of having a trigger that will automatically create an event for attendance on the Participant Profile and assign the course id.¬† Users can then get there to fill in the score.

issues.summary: Support text-pattern for data elements in Tracker and Event programs
issues.creator: Blake Hansen
issues.description:
The advent of the "text pattern" for tracked entity attributes was a big win for the generation of auto-generated IDs based upon a pre-defined pattern. The new feature of this ticket requests the ability to auto-generate IDs through tracker domain type data elements, as well.

This is because it can often be useful to auto-generate an ID in event programs (or certain program stages of a tracker program) where data elements are in play, and not TEA.

Use-cases:

** In NTD programming, an auto-generated ID is used per event (survey) to designate an ID to the particular survey¬†*and*¬†another ID to a particular survey moment. (For example a planned survey gets an ID, and if it is carried out as intended it receives the same ID again. Whereas if that survey gets delayed, perhaps because of COVID, the survey moment ID is generated anew and would be different to the original.)
** In certain event programs where individuals are measured, they may require a random case ID.
** I'm sure there are plenty more, but they escape me right now üòâ

**Other Jira sources:**

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-1994](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-1994) 
Currently, only Tracked Entity Attributes can be configured to be auto-generated and possibly unique values (see separate JIRA issues for specifications of pattern-defined case values).

A similar type of Data Element is urgently required for Disease Surveillance, where you typically set up a "Contact Tracing" (tracking people who has been exposed to a pathogen or an infected individual) stage to store names, address, phone numbers etc for contacts being traced and monitored. Each such contact will have a unique Contract Tracing ID.

NOTE in this context that whereas we CAN use a "Child Program" for tracking contacts, we find it's better to use a repeatable stage for it - mainly due to the very limited options in DHIS2 for analysing data from multiple programs.

[https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-19558](https://dhis2.atlassian.net/browse/DHIS2-19558) 

We are implementing a Birth Notification program using a **DHIS2 Event Program**. However, we have identified a key limitation: unlike Tracker Programs, Event Programs do not support the use of a **unique identifier per event instance** that can be referenced independently across systems or used for tracking individual submissions over time.

In our use case, it is crucial to associate each birth notification event with a **globally unique identifier**, similar to the {{Tracked Entity Instance UID}} in Tracker Programs. This UID would facilitate:

** **Interoperability**: Enable linkage with other systems (e.g., CRVS, HMIS, or Civil Registration) through consistent identifiers.
** **Data reconciliation**: Allow deduplication or merging of data based on the unique ID.
** **Audit and traceability**: Provide a consistent reference for follow-up or verification processes.

**Suggested Implementation:**

** Introduce an optional **auto-generated UID** field for Event Program instances.
** Alternatively, allow configuration of a custom unique identifier field (using program-stage data elements) with enforcement of uniqueness.
** Ensure this UID is exposed via API endpoints and UI views (e.g., Event Reports, Event Capture).
** Ideally, support integration with identifier generation strategies (e.g., UID, UUID, sequential number with prefix).

**Use Case Context:**

** **Country**: South Sudan
** **Program**: Birth Notification (Event Program)
** **Challenge**: Current design lacks a persistent reference ID, creating challenges in referencing events externally.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

** A unique identifier can be auto-generated or configured in an Event Program.
** Identifier is accessible via API, UI, and exports.
** The identifier behaves similarly to Tracked Entity Instance UID in terms of persistence and uniqueness.

issues.summary: Lock specific data entry cells (subset of data elements) after set expiry period
issues.creator: Blake Hansen
issues.description:
I would like to request a new feature that allows the selective "locking" of certain data entry fields within a data set or an event.

¬†

**Within a data set:**

Similar to Expiry days or Data Input Periods this feature would allow a user to select specific data element operands (or just data elements) within a data set upon which to¬†*lock*¬†the data after a user-defined period - i.e. this would mean greying out the value so it was locked in, no longer being able to update a value.

The UI for this would need to allow the specification of¬†*one*¬†period to lock (of expiry period, expiry days so "2" and "months")

The period should allow for negatives. So, if an annual data set is chosen and data is entered in the current period (2021), and -6 months is chosen, then the selected cells would lock in June 2021 (i.e. -6 months from the end of the period)

Additionally a user authority to override the lock.

**Within an event/tracker program:**

A program rule action should be created to "lock value" - which would mean a value is locked should a user go back to edit an event at a later date. This could be triggered using an expression like "d2:daysBetween(V\{event*date},V\{current*date}...)

Again, the same user authority should allow the override of this lock.

***Use-case:***

In NTD programming, Work planning is carried out to define which EUs within a Country should have a survey or not. Given extenuating circumstances a planned survey may be cancelled or postponed. For example, in a COVID year like 2020. It is important to know when the survey was postponed or cancelled but the original planned date of the survey should not change. There needs to be a window of time to allow the planning to occur, but after 3 months of the planned year have passed, it should not be possible to change the planned survey date; but rather the date should "lock in" and the actual survey date should be used. (Users have a habit of wanting to get hteir planned and actual dates aligned and so edit both.)

issues.summary: Cache clean request (pop-up, alert)
issues.creator: Ramon Jimenez Pomareta
issues.description:
We are experiencing many problems with our users related to cache when updating a program, a dataSet, a dashboard, or any metadata in the platform.

Users are usually not aware or they simply do not retain, that DHIS2 is keeping a cache of what they use in DHIS2. So, each time any piece of metadata is updated, they are having many issues that get resolved when a cache clean is done.

Knowing that we cannot force a cache clean on our users, I was thinking something like an alert or a pop-up could be implemented. So when a user is seeing by the first time a new version of a program or a dataset, DHIS2 propose/recommends the user to perform a cache-clean, or even forbids the access before a cache clean has been done.

This could be set at program/dataset level, or at a usergroup level.

Thanks!

It would be very useful to make it easier for users to find the dashboard/information they are looking for if a superuser could group dashboards together so that they appear as a single entity at the top of the screen, and when clicked worked something like the organization unit hierarchy. I can think of examples where multiple layers maybe used, something like groups and group sets, but even a single layer of grouping would be useful.

Pete

issues.summary: Constants - management
issues.creator: Yury Rogachev
issues.description:
1. Is it possible to make Constants part of "Program dependency"?
Currently, if we use constants in program rules or program indicators, the export does not check whether constants are referenced in the program.

2. Apart from using constants in a way that is currently described in the documentation, constants are currently used to configure generic packages.
Example: Generic tracker program offers a program stage for laboratory testing and includes 3 various tests organised into sections. Country A uses all tests (1,2,3) while country B uses only 2 tests (1,2). Country "B" changes the value of a constant and a program rule hides the section 3 from data entry forms. If country B starts using test 3 at some point, they can just change the value of a constant. This way, there is no need to delete/recreate metadata.

Is it possible to add the following features to constant management?
1. Constant groups (Similar to Program Indicator groups).
2. Constant type: (to be considered):
a) "regular constant" (e.g. Pi,¬†‚àö2, etc).
b) "configuration constant" (turning certain features of a program on and off).

2.a Could constants also be configured to hide dashboardItems?
This is a feature similar to a ProgramRuleActionType.
